Hoohz94uUDToEGWa1Q8C_A.text: Dirt Dog has never disappointed and I have tried all of their dogs. My favorite is the brown dog. I'm so glad it's close to home. Although all the food is great my absolute favorite thing on the menu is the Churro Ice Cream. I can't visit Dirt Dog without having ice cream. It's AMAZING!!

KQj5ARu2boww9XAzAHCWGg.text: This is the best hot dog east of LA Just like my fav street vendor on Santee! Their street tacos are delicious too!  Try the dirty corn! Yum

n06nUHrilyxbekgZrv09HA.text: Love this place. I became a vegetarian 5 months ago. I looked up their menu and they have a vegetarian hotdog!!!!! I was so excited! I went there for my birthday dinner and it was amazing!!!! Highly recommended this place!!!

ACBjzK6M9HGx83VT1CmKgQ.text: Tried this place on a whim.Not a real big hotdog fan and being from Chicago,I was tired of eating Chicago style hotdogs..Tried the "Brown Dirt Dog" along with the garlic fries and seasalt fries..Also tried the "Chilli Dog"..The food was fantastic being these hot dogs are "dressed up".The fries are delicious.If Dirt Dog came to Chicago they would definately put a twist and much needed improvement on the current hot dog business..The quality of food is excellent and I hope it stays that way.Every big city should have this franchise.

OlOQklbS_VGjKVJS-fKrfQ.text: I was introduced to this place by my boyfriend; dope decision. They play Tupac, their playlist is A1, and it just gives off a complete West Coast ambiance. It's really chill here. Atmosphere is great. The employees here are very welcoming, and have a lot of patience. This is the place where you wanna bring friends to catch up on life. I ordered the Chili Cheese dog with the lobster bun. Lobster bun is basically a buttery texas toast and it complimented the hot dog. Good food, good vibes. Would definitely come here again, and maybe spend time here a little longer if I'm not alone.

g-uqBXAne-8dbT6wf6XmBw.text: I am definitely not a hot dog person but if I'm ever craving a hot dog I come here!!! Good food and a chill atmosphere. You should also try the dirty corn. Sooooo good!

yMk9Rl8e3JpfLsefGdWj0w.text: This place has personality, good music and great food! The staff is super friendly and so down to earth. They have board games and the overall experience was great! The ranchero dog was bomb AF. Definitely coming back again soon!

14eGvEqRfcGz-1jikdEMoQ.text: Dogs are ok. They look huge in the pictures but are pretty small. $30 bucks for two cokes, two dogs and one corn.  Very overpriced for what you get and food was very bland.

6MILLiz1pv1fz7s0wFL-Cw.text: Pretty good hot dogs. The garlic fries were definitely on point. My fiancee and I shared the red dog and the patty melt one. Patty melt was definitely better. Would definitely come back!

PAKRU3mVAGUhc8EaPZYKPQ.text: Great place to grab a quick bite and the service was  fantastic.  We tried several different hot dogs which they offered to cut in half so they can be shared.  Keep in mind three hot dogs shared between two is plenty and you could even get away with two since the hot dogs were above average size.  We weren't huge fans of the patty melt dog, the house was very good, but the best was the teriyaki dog.  Also, get the Mexican corn in a cup as well as the ice cream both were delicious, you won't be disappointed.   The young lady running the counter was not just friendly and helpful but really cared about meal and made several recommendations and accommodations.... not sure if she was the owner but either way she treated us like friends who just walked in off the street.   You should make your way here if you are in town, it's a quick 5-10 car ride from the strip.

Aj4MDWxUiKyD-KaycUOvrQ.text: My husband been wanting to try this spot and I must say it was extremely good. SADLY! Its across town for us however it definitely was worth the trip!

Un4oQYLZ_3IsDEgiOhEVPw.text: I only had their house dog and corn at the spring festival. I have to say I'm impressed! Both were delish. Going to visit their restaurant soon

Ao6Em1ZFniNbRqDnbwap7w.text: Best hotdogs in town! We order carry out most of the time , but even at home the food is great. From the customer service to the corn and hot dogs everything is on point. Anyone looking for a good new spot to try this is definitely the place to try.

IFKlqSJZoOoWghb206_gpA.text: Very busy but worth it.!!!  Had the green Chile dog and garlic fries. Would do over and over

cd1bH2AkDyJZ_yMo5TgMRg.text: Great service. The green dog was on point and the red dog was kick ass! The Corn was so delicious... but the best part was definitely the horchata & churo ice cream. We're definitely coming back!

H6WHF66X-1mXjaso5FwNAQ.text: The workers are nice and helpful, always a plus. The original dog is just perfect on a lobster bun with a side of dirty fries. The horchata with the churro ice cream is not to sweet, creamy and tasty. They have a secret menu so ask the cashiers. Also try some of their draft beers, the dark ones are good, but that's because that's what I prefer. The music is chill-some old skool, can't go wrong with that! So enjoy and trust me you will be back for more , stay dirty!!

lSPOWNLwEci7YO4EeCPOjQ.text: If you love hot dog you MUST try this place out.  Their  hot dogs are just so damn good.  I try something new each time and have never been disappointed.  They also added tacos to their menu which are pretty good. Not anything over the top, but then again, I'm not too picky with tacos.  If you're just looking to chill, vibe and eat something good go check this place out.  Lines get long but trust me, it's worth the wait.

PwsZfToOGP84QmiRjYJ3WA.text: they're fries are too salty and the elotes have no taste. overall the desserts and hot dogs are really good!

ftp5D8y4oHedWlkKHLZJuw.text: Stopped here for the first time tonite. Food was great. They need a tune up on the audio tracks playing. Felt like my gangstas gunna be bustin a cap in da hood with all the gansta rap playing. Almost made meal time unenjoyable

ckfcVGfYPlNc8229mmIYhw.text: Finally made time to check this place out if even it wasn't on purpose. On our way to Cafe Zupas when we came up on Dirt Dog rather quickly, and I had seen this establishment on Yelp and had it bookmarked so when I noticed it on my right, I knew I just had to brake hard and make the right turn into the parking lot. As soon as my friend and I went in we were hit with some Tupac playing through the speakers. My friend was like, yeah this place has some flavor! So the menu is on the wall, with pictures to go with the description which I found very helpful, sometimes it's better to see  than read what you're ordering. My friend got the Dirt Dog, and I had the green dog and we ordered two tacos al pastor. The al pastor although good wasn't the best but this place is called Dirt Dog and we came for the dogs! Both our choices didn't disappoint, they were both delicious. They offer a choice of buns, I recommend the Portuguese bun for .50 cents more.  The staff were friendly and attentive, and multiple times asked how were doing and asked us how we heard about them. Dirt Dog is definitely a place we will frequent, make sure you give this place a visit!

N_NON_TUXYiGtw4USEDtjw.text: Super great feel when I walked into the place. The menu definitely struck me first, next the music and then the murals of Kobe and Tupac towards the back. The tribute to two of LA's easily most recognizable put a smile on my face.   The woman at the front taking orders was very friendly and helpful with suggestions and descriptions for first timers. Their offerings are not just regular ballpark hot dogs. They offer creative gourmet hot dogs and more that will have you salivating from just reading descriptions on a menu.

DTC46RzNBpptGdNAQvw3oA.text: The dirty chili dog is the best hot dog I've had, and the staff was happy while ringing the registers like pros. When I arrived 25 people were packed in front, but they took orders quickly and kept the flow moving. The only reason I took away one star is the no firearm sign. Silly signs just upset good law-abiding customers; criminals don't care.

SAqQh9lTD4__5tVTysp8ZQ.text: Apart from the reallllllly long wait, I am huge fanatic of  Dirt Dog. It's hip, simple and inventive with selections ranging from vegetarian hotdogs to corn on a cob. I was smitten from my first visit as I choose from different styles of hotdogs. Who knew such a simple entree can be rather complex?   For dinner, I had torn between the brown dog or the green dog which gives me the reason to return in the future. I opted for The Brown Dog which had teriyaki sauce and sesame seed aioli. Can I just have this everyday of the week, please? The hotdog tasted juicy with noting flavors of sweet and salty. The combination between the two really hit it off as it was finished by caramelized onions.   I also had Dirty Corn which consisted of dirty crema, cotija cheese, chili powder, cilantro and bacon bits. For me, it was a 4/5. I think they could've made it just a tad better but this didn't exactly wow me. The corn was perfectly cooked but the ingredients didn't seem to mixed well together. Something was definitely missing there. Perhaps, a flare of heat?   My girlfriend and I also had the Dirty Chili Fries which was not bad! A bit on the salty side but I wouldn't mind getting it again.   As for dessert, we were offered anything we wanted on the menu due to the long wait. So we chose the Horchata Ice Cream. Delicious to say the least, and if I had a choice, I wouldn't share. Sorry, girlfriend!   The long service is what sort of puts me off from visiting again. The food is delicious but when you're ready to grub, there's no way I'm willing to wait as much as we did the first time around.

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XtV6Ay2z-Q4JnLe_NA6c8Q.text: Recommend Dirt Dog for hot dogs. The fries were alright but the hot dogs were the best part of the meal. It is a fast casual dining experience. The service was better than we expected for this type of a dining atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dRg5RW5rlMubgfx43UfFew.text: We walked in the door at 10:30 AM. Yeah it's a little weird to eat hotdogs for breakfast, but there was bacon on it so I figured I was good. The food did not disappoint it was absolutely delicious. I loved my  Patty Melt Dog, it very flavorful, high quality dog too. Garlic fries were perfect, super crispy outside. They have 8 beer taps, most were craft beer (if that is something you like)Employees are super helpful friendly The place was very clean and the decor is way cool if you enjoyed the West Coast rap, music was perfect for this gal. Will def be back to try another dog and dip into those desserts.

51mFSIOkqeCNebso2kfGDw.text: Sadly I gotta lower my rating...:(   The ambiance looked great. It looked like that in between my visits that they had updated alot of stuff. Tables and the bar area were awesome. Very clean and very open. Loved the layout but it was a tad cold as in not temperature cold but not very inviting...4/5  Service was still off... Maybe I keep on getting them on off times. I entered and looked at the menu boards...I was greeted right away by a lady in the kitchen but the guy that was taking the order was busy doing something... I'm not sure what but there were only 2 tables and they already had their food. I waited a bit and he came and took my order. (3/5) the only reason why I have him a 3 is because he remembered that I asked for extra lime wedges and brought them out.  Food was sadly where they missed it this time. They are known for their hot dog wrapped bacon. Well this time the bacon was chewy and not crisp and no char at all. The lobster roll was toasted almost too dark but sadly the bacon was white since it was mainly fat and limp and just soggy and stringy. The hot dog had no char which added so much for to my dog last time. I got the mutt and the toppings were actually better then last time but the main part... The hot dog wrapped bacon was soooooo sad. :( And I waited almost 15 minutes for this dog. I understand that they are trying for quality over quantity...I get that and respect that... But when I wait 15 minutes and the dog and the bacon is soggy and limp.... The respect goes out the door and I have to wonder what the heck were they doing back there????? (1/5)  The dirty Esquite was the best thing I had today.  It was pretty good but even with all the kernels that get stuck in between my teeth...I stick with the dirty corn... It was good but it had too much crema for my taste it was on the verge of being too creamy. The corn still had great texture which was very glad for. (4/5)  Will I be back.... Maybe... They are very close to me but the hot dog was such a disappointment today. If I do come back it might just be for the corn... Not sure if I want to try the bacon wrapped dogs again with it being so inconsistent. :(

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Mutt Dog!!! On the lobster roll...50¢ extra....
Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dirty Esquite....3.25...4/5

9EPvJXYpzvK9o6uVP7DI6A.text: Drive was kinda far, but worth every mile. Definitely will be returning. Best hotdog place I've eaten.  You MUST try it. You won't be sorry.

Ll_mghsC31GeuDikXSuGEA.text: Visiting Las Vegas from Austin, TX and found Dirt Dog totally by accident. Best. Accident. Ever.  It was 10:00 on a Saturday night. The line was long, but moved quickly. We placed our order, asked a few questions, and sat down to wait.  After about 5 minutes our server arrived with the best food I've had in a long time. My friend hasn't stopped raving about the esquite and I couldn't get enough of the garlic fries. The dogs were amazing and the beer was cold.  I don't get what someone else was sayin about the price. 2 huge entrees, 2 sides, and 2 beers for $35 is a bargain.   I will definitely be back on my next trip.

3dqPLzcqsPqrEDni7FpcrA.text: I went there for the first time during my travels out in Vegas. It was a place a friend of a friend recommended to us. I love elotes, which was one of the things we wanted to try out. My friend ordered a dirt dog for us to split between both of us and two elotes. The food was amazing!! I loved the bacon bits, special sauce, bread used for their hot dogs, cheese, you name it! Foodgasm at its finest!   The food scene in Chicago is amazing and I really hope a place like this opens up in our city. I visited this place one more time before heading out towards my flight. The cashier was so friendly. Atmosphere there is pretty cool! They play good music, I wanted to get on the table and dance. I won't make a fool out of myself though. But yeah, everyone must try this place out!

Pgml3xTyteOnnwuYF1vtCg.text: Hot foggy foggy good food! They have all type of dogs even vegetarian ones it's yummy dummy in my tummy wummy! Good service and place great music!

OjcGrgTlmX3W_YSCtgRAIA.text: I had the best experience here, the food was unique. Never knew you could do so much with a hot dog LOL. I mean that in the best of ways LOL. There was so many different dogs to choose from, they all looked great. The other items on the menu also presented a good variety. We chose the garlic fries as our side dish and they was scrumptious. The portions were ample. The service was excellent. Definitely worth a stop by no matter how far you have to drive.

N0PRu7hNxu2vAMwOAQpMKA.text: Nice that this place is right down the road!! The food here is amazing! We came in one day and ordered and have been back multiple times!!! The prices are affordable and would recommend to anyone looking to try something new.   The lobster bun is a must!! I wouldn't have it any other way! Also you must have the deep fried oreos! Enjoy!!

E3kQxBloXg2mVyVZJppa2g.text: Amazing! Oh my goodness! This place has the best hot dogs ever. Nice menu with several options. We are so happy we found this place and it's close to home. If you like hot dogs, definitely try this place!

kBQyfdRQKU4arxaDZm90Ng.text: I wasn't too impressed with their food..and the layout of the restaurant is kinda smooshed and crowded. I think the only thing that i found memorable was the Tupac mural

KxkpTua0pYKwJyYD0X_-Og.text: Went by for lunch today. We had the...  green dog - good. Wish it had more Chimichurri sauce  chili cheese dog - good. Tons of chili Pastor loaded fries - ok Garlic fries - very good Flaming corn - good. Very spicy. The corn was perfect though.  Horchata ice cream - awesome!!   One beer and one soda   Bad part of the place was they only had one cashier. The line took forever. The front door was right in the middle of the line.  So you had people waiting and people tying to leave.   Overall the food was good. Great beer selection as well   $46 for all of it.

HP7DnSnUeT4v3D1D_HRb2g.text: So I really wanted to like this place, and I sort of did. Let's start with good : I liked the hot dog and the hot dog selection . The garlic fries were fantastic! Even the soda was on point ! Now the bad : all the tables were dirty with no sign of anyone coming to clean them. And no offense, I didn't like the non stop loud rap music . It was a bit much for me .

QVyWoLCJKYrAHzaY4GxEZA.text: My boyfriend and I been wanting to try this place since it was all over Instagram and it did not disappoint!!! Would recommend the patty melt hot dog, I liked that one the best (out of the three hot dogs we ordered lol)

Sh8lwKU7bSgwK3ZLa1ZTEA.text: Dirtdog was an interesting, and tasty experience to say the least. Located on the southwest side of town, on rainbow and windmill. Walked in about 7:30 in the evening, and this place was packed!!! We had to wait about 15-20 minutes but worth it. I haven't seen hotdogs with the kind of toppings this place has.. definitely check it out if you're into something completely different than the typical hot dog meal. I played it safe and went with the dirty chili dog and it was amazing!! My friends went with the brown dog, and the elote dog and were equally impressed. They also have elotes and tacos available here!! We ordered carne Asada fries and filthy fries and it was so perfectly crispy and seasoned.. and we couldn't leave without the fried Oreos, which had a horchata cream with it. So good! Ambience is casual. Can't wait to come back

vwcT2Rvi50OgCPX_fooUgw.text: Not a huge hot dog fan but this place always hits the spot. I've tried a few but always keep coming back to the mutt dog, it won't disappoint.

AC7tzYJ6TQAXpGF0HD_ouQ.text: Super big fat, juicy beef hot dog omg the patty melt dog is my fav it's a big fat dog on a Texas toast style bun + wrapped in center cut bacon, topped with bacon cheddar fries and chiptole aioli spread. yeah you have to see the pics to believe me. This is not a chain, this is a young entrepreneurs place that I hope everyone visits. Not only to keep small business alive but this is super great, real food. It's pricey - we had two dogs, two drinks and a side of fries and a side of corn it was $30 but for sure worth it, very tasty and unique!

8-6R27456QWj0_8xVBu05A.text: This is hands down my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. Definitely make sure you stop by for at least a hotdog and some fries.The establishment was very clean and organized. Sean was our host and he went well out of his way to make sure my visit went as smoothly as possible. He even recommended a few choices over others based on my favorite types of foods. Staff regularly checked to make sure my table wasn't cluttered devoured food baskets and would kindly ask if everything was going well. They even had a wall full of a variety of hot sauces for customers to choose from. The hotdogs and orders of fries we had were top notch and full of delicious flavors. I'll absolutely be coming back as a regular.

P-qz6OsFMQojLRRVx2XtUw.text: the special dogs here were amazing! And the wall of hot sauce was awesome ! But the best thing about dirt dog hands down was the excellent service from Venessa. She was the nicest sweetest person who could've served us. I haven't had service like that since as long as I remember. She was simply the best!!! Come check this place out !

gjtnz7D9vLCRpMX8_58_Ng.text: The House Dog (highly recommend) The Mutt dog (flavor was a bit off) Filthy Fries (recommend but they change the type of fries they use) Churros (wasn't crispy at all, way over dusted with cinnamon, would not order again)

HOWGK1EbUTz5JyDAiJp68g.text: I really liked this place. Reasonable prices and the food was great. I would definitely recommend this to anyone that has been on the fence about trying it out.   I had the patty melt dog and it was so good.

te2ug55BkZnrLTMLNyC2CA.text: Tried this place on a whim one night, and have probably been back at least 1x a week since! (Mainly because my boyfriend is obsessed)  He gets the Brown dog, carne asada fries, and deep fried oreos.. every.. time..   So far I have tried: carne asada tacos, soyrizo tacos, the green dog, carne asada fries, the churro, horchata ice cream, and the deep fried oreos! All were amazing, but my go-to probably has to be the carne asada fries.   The servers are attentive and friendly. They get extremely busy, but still keep the place very clean. The only reason for 4 stars is because there have been 2 or 3 occasions where they have gotten our order wrong. Besides that, it's great!

yTTXwVGiFORsD6EKNXy65A.text: Great environment I wanna love the place because I wanna hang out here but the cost of Theodore and the quality isn't the greatest so it removes 2 stars for those. Sorry guys it's a hot dog should never be $12 for one lol especially the size of the meal. I would say if you haven't tried it defiantly try it.

kGHrfGwN5UD3TnBLLsr6uA.text: Spacious inside. Cashier was a super friendly guy. This is just a first visit so will revise after the next visit.   Didn't do the small upgrade for lobster roll but seeing as I didn't enjoy the bun at all this time, I'm definitely going to try for the upgrade next time.  Wanted the Veggie Dog but they were out so opted for the Green Dog.  Went with 2 other friends and we each got a different kind of fries. I got the Dirty Fries and that was the best of the three. Friends got Garlic Fries, and Sea Salt & Pepper fries (quite bland). The seasonings are very light so we didn't really prefer them much. I will be back to try out their Dirty Corn next time as my side.  Gonna get a different Dog each time I come back, but for now, I would recommend the Dirty Fries if you're going to get any fries.

iWUk2TwWXVIJNZZvDD-A4A.text: Atmosphere was great and upbeat, service was great, got our food very fast--within 5 or 7 minutes. Many different choices, planning another trip soon so i can try more of their hotdogs. Got the elote dog and it was delicious! 10/10 would recommend.

DuumJc_ZJ0Ygw0Gi2GelCg.text: Yes, yes and hell YES! Great food and excellent service. No wonder the locals love it.

9kzLfw1c0YMkujTmdNOHXA.text: I love hot dogs. It's hard to find a good hot dog place in Vegas. Dirt Dog is a one of those places where they try to gourmet something that's not typically gourmet'ed. They do a fairy good job of it. To be honest I'm old school and prefer my hot dogs with everything Chicago style including tomatoes and celery salt. But you really can't find that here especially since Sammy hot dogs hut closed down. So you get some nasty one like at Nathan's. Or a cheap one like at Costco (get what you pay for), or go gourmet at dirt dog. I'll recommend gourmet out of those choices - weird but good.

xfstl706aGz4KJ7L970Wdw.text: There was a line about 15 people deep when we came in but knew it was worth the wait.  The decor of the place was super cool. They have a huge map of Vegas on the wall so you can put where you in the valley you came from to eat here. Austin was super friendly and helpful with any questions we had. The tables were cleaned super fast after people left which was nice. We got the brown dog, the party melt dog and the house dog with a side of dirty fries. Overall it was pretty good. I would recommend this place for anyone. They also had street tacos and vegan and vegetarian options which I though was pretty cool.

iFfK6Pm84Acp7PsE7swwuQ.text: Just ok but not as great as I was told. Pretty much average food. Wonder what all the hype is about?

Q4ToVnJNByqVy-YbPRy9kg.text: Super busy, there was a line. But work the wait. Only thing is that it's a bit pricey paid 36 dollars for 2 hot dogs and 2 fries it was worth it! Customer service is really good which is why they deserve 5 stars. Food is served at a timely manner.

5XeP6P-eceuJ4F1C5TYN6A.text: Delicious street food hot dogs! Bacon wrapped goodness with a lot of yummy sides and snacks.

YUninX9Mr_a9zcT38NZYDw.text: Heard many good things, so we had to check it out ourselves. We drove about 30 min across town to get here and it was worth it! We ordered the elote dog, filthy fries, carne asada tacos, and the horchata ice cream. They use 100% beef hot dogs wrapped in bacon! It was all so good, we will definitely be back!

fwYrDxUSyqFdHS5-izXYgw.text: I saw this place as being a suggestion on Instagram, saw all the great reviews and decided to try it. Walked in today (Sunday) and line wrapped around the bar. I figured since their menu was pretty small it wouldn't take that long to order. We spent 20 minutes in line just to order the food. Then stood for another 10 minutes waiting for an employee to clear and clean the tables so we could have a seat. Seating was very limited and cramped. After another 5 minutes we got our fries and another 5 mins after that we got our hot dogs. The toppings on the hot dogs were original and I've never had anything like them, but it wasn't worth the 40 minute overall wait time. Portuguese rolls were the best part of the hotdog. The employees were friendly but didn't have much pep in their step in terms of cleaning and getting the food out. We had to get napkins to re clean the seats after the employee came and wiped them down. The bathrooms were not clean. As I stated before, the majority of the tables weren't cleaned the entire time we had been waiting in line and we still had to wait for them to be cleaned after we ordered. Just a personal preference: it would have been nice to hear some music other than Tupac, maybe NWA or something else.... change it up a little.

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VkvqWty3URoLe98IcE1-tA.text: Staff was very nice.. Ordered a house dog- bacon wrapped dog - California dog all the way... It was great!  Carried a good selection of beer.. Suggested a Ballast Point sculpin of course! Vanessa the Assistant manager was very nice and did a great job of taking care of everyone. Glad I went back.

clLG_Sy_S3QLJ99J3dVQHg.text: We each ordered a dog and spilt an order of fries and it was plenty!   The dogs are so big you have to eat with a fork and knife!  The only downfall is that you have to sit outside.  Food was good though!  Excellent service too!

iMM9JOSl2K1W4oH_W2RjWw.text: Great taste, and not so big that you can't eat it comfortable without making a huge mess. She had the patty melt dog, I had the dirty chili dog, and we split the dirty esquite (corn), everything was great. Bonus- Tupac themed!

4Y4G3l--12wcpjJQsRxVnA.text: Recently gave this place another go. I will say I appreciate the effort to add more value. Well done guys. Maybe my past experience could have been everyone working out the kinks from just opening.

EueKLopbJDDKjuzdQSkuXQ.text: If your looking for a good hot dog with a kick this is the place!!  Also you're crazy if you don't try the dessert menu from deep-fried Twinkies to deep-fried Oreos this is the place to be!   The red dog was my favorite along with the deep-fried Oreos!   Say what's up to Cameron in the kitchen he's the man!

MLKG8h9x3BT9UTWsPR0I9g.text: I'm not a big hot dog person for starters. So I was a little reluctant to try an all hot dog spot. But I saw an add for this place come across my FB and it had more content  than just your simple Nathan's hot dog. So we came in and I'm glad we did!  The beauty in coming to a new spot with my spouse is we split. So I get to try more without stuffing myself. He ordered their red dog and I tried the green dog. We split the dirty corn, garlic fries and a Twinkie. Although it was so good we almost had to order two twinkles.  The red dog was great. Nice and spicy, covered in bacon and veggies.  The green dog was not spicy but had a zesty and refreshing flavor that calmed the spice from the red dog down.  The garlic fries are plain fries with a delicious garlic dipping sauce so you can control how much anti vampire flavor you want. I will be getting TWO sides of this on my next visit.....it was YUMMY!  The corn was missing the creaminess of the mayo that I'm accustomed to with street corn. That being said it was still very good. It came on a stick so it was easier to handle covered in cheese, bacon and cilantro.  And lastly, when you come in save room for desert! I might have to stop in just for late night fried Twinkie runs....this could be dangerous! They serve it with a light dipping sauce that really complements the Twinkie.  We've already picked out what we will be trying on our next visit!

Auy5b48vU5DxN04xbzhL0w.text: Definitely my new favorite spot in town for a sloppy fat meal - what a top button buster! Chilli dog, carne asada tacos, corn esquite were all super good. We can't wait to eat the horchata ice cream next time!

rEE42kNfG6GZTRBbfbk9Aw.text: Stopped by here with my husband tonight and we were pleasantly surprised. Spacious restaurant with easy to choose menu. Good beer choices on tap although they were out of a few due to changing out the kegs. Overall a good neighborhood restaurant with good service, good beer and delicious hot dogs. Will be visiting again.

rMlISOwBrScS7OSelhvqgw.text: Ok , so I saw the great reviews had to try it out. My gf, daughter & I got a mutt dog, red dog & dirty fries & kids meal with chicken nuggets.  Red dog & mutt dog were so spicy we couldn't finish half probably due to the fact it looked like the red pepper shaker broke & opened while making it. Seriously about 4 tablespoons of red pepper flakes on a hot dog. Kind of a let down when they are $6.25 a hot dog. (Keep in mind a in n out burger is $3) Fries were pretty basic "spicy ketchup" was ketchup & tobasco. Kids meal was also a let down $7, 5 frozen nuggets & fries with oreos. Service was attentive & knew the menu which is why it got 3 stars. My suggestion include fries with dogs & make meal $7.

Don't do dogs unless its DIRT!

rMx7FB7z3oNbPWnjpf84xg.text: Place is very welcoming to all. You walk in and are greeted properly. I have been to this location 2 times for dine in and 1 for pick up and I have not been disappointed. 82MfQgGG62HGZyOTTQJgrw.text: In a nut shell: great experience and filling despite the size.   Service: The service here was amazing, Priscilla (sorry if I spelt it wrong) was especially a great help. She gave me a quick run down on the menus and was able to make my first visit enjoyable. The food came in less than 5 minutes which is a bonus.   Food:   Flaming dog: dog was juicy and hot (temperature wise). Sadly it was not as spicy as i hoped it to be. But don't be discouraged in trying it, overall was a good dog with a good kick from the habanero sauce.  Recommended on a traditional bun. Caution: the dog can get messy.    Dirty chili dog: from my whole visit this one was my favorite. It reminded me of a sloppy joe. Ordered on a lobster bun (buttered and toasted on both sides). The only down side to this dog was the onions being too thick. But its more of my personal preference. Caution: the dog does have a tendency to go for a slip and slide.   Dirty elote: decided on the most basic corn. This item I would rate 3/5 partly because the elote back home (oxnard) has a special place in my heart.   Dessert: If I were to come back for one thing, it would be the dessert. The horchata ice cream is a must.   Drinks: wide beer selection, sadly was not able to try any this visit. House made horchata and melon fresca. Self service soda fountain as well.   Cons: If you have a big appetite the portions might be a tad bit small. Some tables weren't wiped down and spacing is quite tight.

INLkk9ZHz_9KOY_kBCmTOg.text: Being from LA I was hoping this would feel a lot like a dirty dog. Don't get me wrong, I got the flamin dog and it was really good and I really enjoyed it. My girlfriend got the elote dog and it was good too. There's a reason why they call it dirty dogs, or a danger dog but of course I understand, this is a business and cleanliness and sanitation is very important. I feel almost weird saying all this like I'm not sure if people get me, because real dirty dogs in LA are super unsanitary but man they are so good. Regardless though the point I'm saying is it's no where near an actual dirty dog but regardless it's still super good. I'd go back. I really like the hot Cheetos they put and it had a nice crunch to it compared to this one other spot I go to called Zero Degrees and their hot Cheetos elote fries kind of suck. So this was good. Definitely want to try more.   Also the restroom is very reminiscent of LA with the the mirrors lol

nVh1kbKITiRH9LAi_uw_kA.text: Specialty hot dogs and fried desserts?  Yes, please!  Anywhere that has fried twinkies on the menu immediately gets my attention.  We ordered one house dog (with bacon thousand island dressing, which was still a little spicy despite removing the green chilie spread) and three patty melt dogs (which comes wrapped in bacon and topped with chipotle aioli, melted cheddar fries and bacon bits). Spring for the sweet lobster roll bread, which costs 50 cents extra -- your tastebuds will thank me later.  We opted not to order fries (although they looked delicious) and went straight to dessert.  Fried oreos (comes with two), a fried twinkie and churro topped off our meal.  All were tasty but the sleeper hit was the churro, which seemed like an excellent value.  Just a couple bites through our meal and we decreed that Dirt Dog would be on the list for future stops in Vegas (or LA).  That type of declaration does not happen so frequently.  So heed these words wisely -- a first visit to Dirt Dog will ruin other future hot dog eateries for the rest of your life.  It's a big risk to take, but one worth taking!

DbIJU16vVxvDNa_Ik8F0jw.text: A good friend of mine could not stop raving about Dirt Dog so I needed to give this a place a try. Once you enter, the register is a few feet away and the wall menu is immediately to your right. You order your food, get a number, and seat yourself wherever you like.   The guy who took our order, Kevin, was amaazzingg! I was not too sure if he was a manager but he needs to be. He went over the menu with me too patiently, and I just had great service the entire time I was there. He even came over to our table a few times to make sure we liked everything.  For the food, I ordered the filthy fries and my friend had the Patty Melt Dog. The fries were so flavorful and the Patty Melt Dog was just woaaaah. Just try it. For the price and the quality, I would say this place gets a 11/10 + 4 thumbs up.  Kevin even talked me into trying one of their house made churros and it was delicious.  I brought my sister on a separate visit and we ordered the elotes with more filthy fries. It was just too good not to order again.  I'm sorry but everything was just too good. Thank you, I'll be back soon :-)

ABEMADkRNzvEx-5wu7qgSg.text: WOW!!! Don't know where to start.....How can a hot dog get so creative you ask!! Well, go to Dirt Dog and find out. The options are so different and clever. The dogs are all beef and amazing. The toppings are so delicious. My friend and I ate here for the first time the other night. Line to the door the entire time we were there. It did move quickly though. The music and "vibe" of the place is so enjoyable. It felt so much like we were in happening LA. As we were eating, a young man came to our table to ask how everything was. I think he was a busboy. His name was Aaron and he was so sweet. Not your typical young kid. He had a great and friendly personality and genuinely wanted to know that we were enjoying our dinner. Shout out to Aaron!!!! So unusual to find a place with all of these positives. Can't wait to go back!!!! Thank you Dirt Dog!!!!

GKaTHePA6DVycodeg8j-mg.text: Hands down the best hot dogs you will ever eat in your life. It's not just a hot dog. It's an entire meal and don't even get my started on the cheesy elotes! -Xhok7dwc0FrhczYm70Ukw.text: This place has always been on my to go places and I finally got the chance to try. It was pretty good.   Each hot dog is apparently wrapped in bacon which makes it even better. You have a choice of buns you can put your hot dog on..from lobster roll (which is $0.50) more or Portuguese roll or regularbhot dog bun.   I ordered the red dogg. Which has chile sauce, peppers and chipotle aioli. It was pretty good. The peppers definitely gave it a good kick of spice. The toppings weren't overwhelming with alot of stuff so you can actually taste the juiciness of the hot dog. Yumm.  My friend ordered the mutt dog which is a mix between the red dogg and green dogg. He said it was pretty good.   I also ordered the filthy fries. Wasn't a huge fan of this one. It has cotija cheese, guacamole, cheese spread and fries. It didn't taste as great as it sounded. Next time I'll stick with regular fries.   Overall it's a good place to try. I would definitely recommend.

JblwcKXz5_RRaB9fKcGOeA.text: Some of theee BEST  servers on top of yummi food its my 4th time here and yett another win !!! anisha and jayden were so cool and patient with my party.. recommend this location!

pkBXoRL4bn0JpyrTFuXnrg.text: Whats better than getting your street food cravings in a clean, indoor spot? My girlfriend and I both ordered their elote dog, and trying to eat it without spilling some food everywhere will be impossible (hence the first word of the place's name). Although the dog was a little pricey for the size ($7.25), the tasty, warm, and all the bacon bits and corn stuffed in and overflowing the bun kind of made up for it.   On the side we got some garlic fries, which were quite unmatched to any other garlic fries I've ever tried. To top this great experience all off the cashier was a nice dude.  Next thing I wanna try when I come back is their dirty corn.

ys9h7NncU9ScTAhhvYsDUQ.text: Solid four stars for the solid solid flavors here. My boyfriend and I came here because we've been having ridiculous pregnant woman cravings for elote. Apparently Dirt Dog hails from LA--but I only heard about it after moving out of LA. LOL! It's located in the very corner of a random plaza, so use your GPS like everyone else has said.  Shoutout to the waitress who was doing everything tonight: taking orders, bringing plates out, bussing tables. She was super friendly and gave us a quick run through of the menu. According to her, the house dog and green dog were their most popular dishes. So we got those and the dirty esquite, which is basically elote in a cup. The house dog was so flavorful--the sauce was so bomb. The green dog was also great and a little more tart, but house dog was my favorite. I do wish their dogs would have a crispy bite to them like the ones at Top Dog in Berkeley, CA. The esquite was actually just ok; the cheese was pretty monotonous, so I added some tapatio to change things up.  I took off a star because it's way too pricey for a fancy hot dog. This place is cool and I can see myself coming back when I have a hankering for fancy hot dogs (who knew that could even be a thing lol)

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green dog with Portuguese bun
Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House dog with Portuguese bun
Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside

4bPKTekYQwFiG5JpejZjiA.text: The wait is torture, the food is okay but not worth the wait. Ive been wanting to go here since I love street corn. I got the corn, it was okay. Im not a fan of hotdogs so I ordered a fried Oreo and Twinkie. Ive never had them before and was not disappointed with the Twinkie. I forgot to get a drink and had to wait in that awful line a second time. Be sure to order all your food when you get to the front because having to order more items is torture. Also make sure you know what you want when you get to the front of the line, the mob behind you might hang you. They have one cashier and minimal sitting. I don't recommend this place to people. I don't really speak of it or do I crave it when I think about it. it a cute concept, the decor is cute but thats about it. I didn't hate it, I just didn't like it either.

_d7X_UVb4DIlEPXDE7lnrw.text: Great food, just overpriced. Really great variety for just a "hotdog" place and the street tacos are actually pretty bomb. The LA swag throughout the restaurant gives it a cool feel too. Definitely enjoyed it, but it's tough to justify the cost so I don't eat here very often.

BUc1baSMssJoZR6LazjBDA.text: It's honestly the best gourmet hotdog in Vegas! I was a little lost when I came in but was quickly helped by a very friendly lady who explained me the different buns and what a few of the ingredients were. We ordered 4 dogs, being two wrapped bacon dogs; one house dog; and one elote dog without chili powder, and also garlic fries along with drinks.  The food came out pretty fast and OH MY GOD! I felt like I was in hot dog heaven! :) Everything was perfect and very, very tasty!  We were constantly checked on by one of the ladies which just made the whole experience better.  As for the place itself, it's s really cool place with lots of murals and the colors along with the decoration were very harmonious. The only one thing I didn't like much was the bathroom because it was a little too dark. I saw a baby changing station, which was great, but in a kinda dark place I think it would be a little uncomfortable to change a baby.  Still, it's a must try if you like gourmet hotdogs!

eTDoyoxn2qTdHni0Ei5BaA.text: I was pretty stoked to try this place, but I'm not sure if I just ordered the wrong thing, but I was pretty disappointed.   Mutt dog with lobster roll: first off, it seemed like I got the end of a bread or something because mine was way thinner than my boyfriend's and the hot dog fell apart after one bite, which was surprising because he got the chili cheese dog. This hot dog was supposed to be 1/2 green dog and 1/2 red dog. The red dog was so overpowering that I couldn't even tell it was a mixture, it felt like I only got the red dog. It was so spicy I couldn't even eat it. It  was so spicy I drank my water and also my boyfriend's water.   Chili cheese dog: it was good. Mostly just tasted like a standard chili cheese dog. The lobster roll on this one is was way better. I wasn't amazed by it.  Elote fries: pretty good, I liked the mixture.   The staff was pretty friendly and patient, which is always a plus.

ItwH8kxuS0H-e-NwZ3T1Aw.text: I always like hotdogs... This place has a few versions I've never had. The dogs were good but the toppings added a different dimension to them. DshbcPcvJiSuHXj88b3_Jg.text: How Dirty will you get? I came to see how dirty it is ;) I ordered some takeout today. I waited 10 mins for my order, not too bad a wait.  The place had a nice atmosphere and very open, hip hop music was playing.  Their Green Dog is flavorful - sweet & citrusy. I had it on the lobster bun and the bun was delicious.  The House Dog was ok and the guy at the counter says that's their popular dog. I couldn't taste all of the individual flavors like the green chile spread, or the bacon.   I especially came here for their Dirty Corn I saw online. It was just okay to me. I definitely tasted the cheese and the bacon bits.   The guy at the front counter was inviting, friendly and helpful as he explained what's popular on the menu.  I would say if you want to stop by for the experience, you should go for it but it didn't knock my socks off.

COMtri2cBhu2nckkqNY6fg.text: Dirt dog is a hot dog that you will never forget! The flavors that the chef has created for these hot dogs on monster sized Texas toast is outstanding. I have eaten here 4 times and have not ordered the same thing twice and can easily give this place five stars. The line moves quickly the staff is friendly and the food is served promptly. You can adjust your order to your taste however I recommend trusting the Chef & Order directly from the menu the dogs are insanely good. The french fries are outstanding. This is not a location where you will go to stay on some sort of diet or eating plan. This is a place where you get an amazingly delicious fresh hot dog made like no other hot dog you've ever eaten. Recommended this too many friends and all have said the same thing this place is amazing!

I liked their lobster roll- style bun as it helps keep it light and not overly burdened with bread, focusing your attention and appreciation on the toppings and the dog itself. I think my favorite thing between the fries, dog and elote corn-in-cup was the corn! But all in all a creative place to get your hot dog & beer fix.

Nj8maH7T9iFL0T3ppyZCUw.text: Inside was hot and muggy and uncomfortable to eat in on a hot summer night so we took food to go.  There was 1 cashier and about 12 people in line and they were so backed up on orders...we waited 25min for our order after 20min in line. Maybe just a bad night?? We wanted a cold beer while we waited for our food but they were out of every beer on tap except for 2, Really? The entrance/exit to this place is crowded by all the people in line...odd placement.  The chili cheese fries were just a handful of lukewarm fries and a spoonful of chill and cheese on top. 4 fries off the top of the box later and my boyfriend just had to eat them plain. The cheese sauce had a powdery texture and just dried up in 5 minutes...kind of odd but that's processed food for you.  The elote cup was good and I thought the Churro was yummy until I got to the middle and tasted batter! It was totally raw.  I'm not sure why all the rest of the food just tasted kinda STALE.  Not all it's hyped up to be that's for sure.

oO-pkfMYegExphCL8NyOUw.text: From my experience, Dirt Dog feels like it's trying to be a modern restaurant coped with a Los Angeles "dirty dog" hot dog stand. Although it caters that theme by playing music that has roots in LA and incorporating art that can be found in the City of Angels, the dog does not hit the note of a True inner city street dog. Granted, the actual hot dog tasted fine (my dog was cold, my wife's was not) and the fries were spectacular, I would say I could come back to try some more.

OMSUx-HXdpeIPxnLU4FHjA.text: Awesome food. Nice LA ambiance. Great service. A but pricey but you get what you pay for.

KaJV8kbmA7E7164cztkpKw.text: The dogs are sooo good. Ordered the brown dog and dirty corn (elote). Awesome food! They play 90's hip hop and the decor is reminiscent of LA. Get the lobster bun with your dog!

zAm67Oh4vmNxS-JBwDJ-gA.text: Let me start off by saying that I'm not a big fan of hotdogs... at all. Dirt dog may have converted me though. Located in the same plaza as Annie pho, I think, and that pet resort. It's very tucked in this plaza & you'll probably miss it if you're not paying attention.   Anyway, I've been here a couple of times & I've ordered the same thing lol. They apparently have a secret menu & obviously it's not written anywhere in the establishment. I usually order the mutt dog & I believe that's a mixture of the green & red dog, but I'm not completely sure. The flavor is amazingggg though. It has a little kick. Throw it in a lobster bun & order some dirty fries & im pretty sure that's what heaven tastes like. I was really excited about having elotes near my house, but unfortunately I didn't like theirs. When I got mine, it was burnt... & I waited over 15 mins for it. I guess I'll have to keep making them at home for now.

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red dog on lobster bun, dirty fries, and the green dog on a traditional bun.

Q-OwuKU54YrQCTxl3e_bJA.text: I don't really miss Los Angeles, so trying this place was pretty low on my priorities. But I finally did and I'm happy with the experience here. It's pretty amusing to see an LA-themed restaurant here in Las Vegas. But I did love the 90s Rap/Hip Hop that's constantly playing. On a side note, there seems to be a Tupac Amaru Shakur tribute vibe here as well (as there should be!) I loved the ambience. They also have those angel wings painted on a wall of which girls love to pose in front of and post on instagram for the 999999th time. But hey, it's free hashtag advertising for this place, right? And they have some board games that you can play at your table while you are visiting.  You have a wide variety of choices and options here. You can get any dog with a choice of your normal bun, Texas toast, lobster bun, or Portuguese bun. I've never tried the Portuguese bun, so I got the Ranchero Dog with the Portuguese today. They also have a lot of other street food type items here as well such as nachos and tacos. And their desserts look fabulous. I didn't try any desserts this time because I could feel my love handles growing just by reading the dessert menu. The dogs themselves are not huge. They are normal length so they won't stuff you. In fact, if you have one of those big "American" appetites, one dog may not satisfy you.  I also had their garlic fries. Very good but a tad oily especially the fries on the bottom of the box.  My only gripe about this visit was that my fries took a while to come out. My dog came out and I finished eating it long before the fries came out. No biggie. I was in no rush. The staff was very cool and friendly so it was fine.  I'm looking forward to coming here again and trying more items. I only had this place a handful of times back in Los Angeles, so I'll try everything else here.

TEgrCEvFUp73Rbl9alBNlQ.text: My wife and I like to go out to eat together, just us, both daughters are in school when we go. I like to call these "Frances and Porter's Excellent Lunch Adventures". Nine times out of ten it's for lunch. Nine times out of ten we say we are going to go to "restaurant a" and wind up going to "restaurant b" or "restaurant c". Always changing our minds.  BUT... thanks to YELP, I came across Dirt Dog, and we went straight there, no stopping. We says pictures of this place and had our minds made up. Turns out Dirt Dog's location is at a former hamburger joint that I just loved.  About 15 minutes after Dirt Dog opened for the day; we went inside and were immediately greeted. By a young lady in a halter top. If not for the fact that she was behind the counter, I would have thought her to be another customer. She was however very informative about the menu. Here's what we ordered.  Fran: The Green Dog: Chimichurri Sauce, Guacamole Spread with Garlic Fries  Porter: The Red Dog: Spicy Tomato Chile Sauce, Chipotle Sauce with Dirty Fires  The food is awesome people. The cost, just under twenty-five dollars!  Fountain drinks for beverages. Sodas, tea that sort. There is also a bar area.  The decor to Dirt Dog is pretty cool but seems unfinished. One wall has a floor to ceiling map of southwest Las Vegas. The other side of the room was a blank wall. Walking towards the restroom is an empty room. This appears to be a waiting room of sorts. A window for take-out at one end, door to the world on the other. A very large sticker of sorts is on a wall in this room. The sticker is of the Dirt Dog logo. But a good portion has come free of the wall.   So here's the plus side:  The Food  So here's what I consider to be a negatives: No staff uniforms, not even name tags Incomplete decorations on the walls.  If you find yourself in Southwest Las Vegas, venture down to Dirt Dog, the food alone is worth the effort and time.

Ye30tGq3Eqm-CrbCWq5cuw.text: Went to Dirt Dog today to see what all the hype was about. I got the ranchero dog, cheesy corn, and garlic fries. First impression the atmosphere is awesome we thought the long line for food would make the wait forever but it moves very fast. We waited about five minutes total to order food which was great. The music was awesome all the employees were very friendly and the cook time for food took about five minutes for all four of my groups large order! It all looked very good almost identical to the menus pictures. The cheesy corn left a lot to be desired and the garlic fries were a little overpowered with spices and garlic. The hot dog which is what I came for was very good. All in all I had a pleasant experience but the food did not live up to the hype. I can see this as a once in a blue moon place to grab food but nothing more than that.

P8oqzi9ArHGXGC3UeDTcgA.text: Dirt Dog is fun, funky and delicious. The service was great and the food was definitely worth going back for. We were a group of 5. We ordered two kids meals, one chicken nuggets and one with corn dogs and the portions were quite generous, they loaded it with fries so my girls were happy. My son went for the patty melt hotdog and it was amazing, I had to sneak a bite because he was not interested in sharing. I ordered the carne asada fries and they did not disappoint, it was a good serving of fries and a large portion of carne asada and toppings. My husband ordered their elote esquite which is corn in a cup with bacon and he ordered the original dog, he also was not interested in sharing because it was so good but he is obligated to share so I can confirm it was as tasty as he claimed.   The only drawback - the restaurant is small and the place is popular so for a larger group like ours, we had a problem finding a place to sit and eat together. So as much as I would like to go again I need to find a better time when it is not as busy so we can eat without feeling rushed.

pD73PIrH4AgmeSDBBNLDhQ.text: Had Dirt Dog first time last night. Ordered 4 dog (two green, one plain-with relish, and 1 cheese), 2 corn and dirty fries). Total was $55. It was tasty and I did enjoy it but the price is outrageous when you really think about what you've purchased - that is a cost of about a week's worth of groceries for a lot of people. For the price, it's not worth it at all, and it would not be something I frequent. I love hot dogs, I make them all the time, and I use Sucker Punch spicy pickles (I dice them into a relish), and it's my favorite fast food at home. With that said, I'm a bit picky with how I like them. I get the hype over this place but I do feel you're better off buying kosher or organic dogs and doing them at home.   Flavors are good and fun to have them every now and then, but again, it's just way too expensive for some wieners. I am happy, though, for the owners and their success.

za8LKaiSry5clJBoGHxhTA.text: Saw the endless ads on Facebook, so I decided to swing by one afternoon.  The staff is helpful explaining the menu.  I ordered and waited for the food while listening to some I guess street music from LA.  The dog was tasty, yet a little on the small side for a serving for the price paid.  I was still hungry!   thought i was at a Major League Baseball game pricing!

PlI4Cjk9lfTxHwBarQLDGw.text: If you love bacon wrapped hot dogs, and let's be honest who doesn't, you'll love dirt dogs. I got the chill dog which was fantastic. The lobster bread is a must. I highly suggest this place. This place is definitely the place to get a hot dog if you want one.

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chill dog!!!

3kt04eJ3gvUI9kgTFi2rew.text: The best hot dog I have ever had! Plus they have elotes "Dirty Corn"! The staff is super friendly too. It almost feels like you are chilling with your friends instead of eating at a restaurant.

2cd4vfhsBPSWLwlnYqJZYA.text: This place is so good it will have you eating the crumbs! The teriyaki brown dog was so good and flavorful. It is kids friendly and the beer is great. Great customer service.

6eZiPGDhCfw8oBCJwkHfkg.text: look, the hot dogs are good. And the dirty esquite tastes great, but for the love of all that is good and holy, make sure you clean the corn silk out of the esquite. It's really irritating to have to pull out those scraggly fibers out with each bite.

txIVyrcrnN2yp6I8cJlc_g.text: Excellent!!! Customer service was amazing and so was the food!! I had the house dog on the sweet roll with garlic fries. The portion size was perfect very freshly prepared the garlic fries came with a very tasty dipping sauce if you love a delicious topped off dog i strongly recommend Dirt Dog. Very clean dining area and again their customer service is just as amazing as their  food!

9_q_Dq2yhO6ujxP8VVnHYw.text: My friends and I had tried their elote fries while having some drinks at Fuel Bar near their strip location in the bazaar shops in front of Bally's. The BF and I wanted something low key for dinner so we made the trek down.  We almost didn't walk in because of the line to the door and it looked like no tables were available. I'm happy to say we stayed and I'm sooooooo glad we did! Variety of dogs and fries, even tacos, and corn! He had the dirty chili dog, I had the House dog and we each shared garlic and elote fries. Hands down best French fries I have ever had! Usually when you order garlic fries, midway through eating them, they turn soggy but not these ones! Seriously the best French fries I've ever eaten!  I was a tad confused by my house dog thinking it would have thousand island dressing, green chili sauce and the standard toppings. I did not expect the ketchup and mustard on it but regardless, it was delicious!  There are so many choices and all look spectacular so we'll definitely be back!

0ybc7mFfEx-NhCKpHG2A3w.text: Interesting menu for hotdogs.  We tried the street tacos but they were tasteless and dry. Tried the Ranchero dog and the brown dog.  They were both good.  I thought that it is a little pricey for a hotdog.

Nkyh1uOSTFGKlENxUetS2w.text: Great great great great!!!!!!!!!! Phenomenal  food can't complain and the cashier was awesome came in at 11 o'clock in the afternoon. Can't remember her name but she was great!

62XfrsqDs6OvRcFWyMniog.text: This place is awesome!! Staff very friendly, always checking to see how your doing or if you need anything else. Well recommended!! Love it and their food is delicious. Always fresh and served on a timely manner. Thank you will be going back soon

KazMek9rOez-XrYYLXHNaw.text: Best hot dogs ever. We came back two days in a row because it was that good! Their filthy fries are amazing as well...and the corn....it's all good. Just go.

w6jYspXjLtf1w3pZAspmxg.text: This place is phenomenal! Our kids loved the hotdogs and the atmosphere, this is a must eat if you live in Las Vegas.

rSEIdi6iiwE8pJPAN998wA.text: The food was tasty the service was great. I can believe how spicy the red sauce hotdog was!

kEBp7qAZUFzeePTmhPZcTQ.text: Amazing dawgs! Must try!!!  Everything on the menu looks good but most importantly everything ordered was good. Try them all you won't be disappointed.

zne5a-mCWgA59aQTWZlXGQ.text: Thus place is different then any other place in Vegas. Good dogs, good fries, and a real chill atmosphere.

wxeWwUls99g0VnSQAohq9w.text: Went in last night with my family it was a little busy but we didn't wait to long! This is the best hot dog I have ever had! The chili dog on Portuguese is the way to go. The servers/cashiers were friendly and attentive. I will definitely be back.

2hH_0BE_jCmPnA3--sQmXg.text: Maaaaaan I'm honestly speechless. I just discovered this place last week & I came back 5 days later cuz it's that good ! It's about a 40 minute drive from me & I'll keep driving the distance as long as their hot dogs stay as good as they are now. Beyond amazed by the flavors on all the menu items that I've had so far. Definitely recommend it. My new go to spot. & they have beer, even better.

T_VaKNGTK0uy9mrZt18Yig.text: Saw it advertised on FB, went today with coworkers tried different dirty dogs, dirty corn and fries. All where awesome. Will definitely come back.

B6KyU19pveisIlQmzvFcFw.text: This place is very slow! Be prepared to wait. Also bring your own drink they are out of almost everything.  Service was below average, looks like nobody cares. I came once before when the first opened same experience but thought it was just because they just opened, now I know

Vym5KKP5vnJQD0yJirFKNQ.text: This is not the same place I've been to several times before. Granted it was busier than I have ever seen them but most people that came in after me ate and left by the time I got my food which was just two kids meals and one patty melt dog. And then when I finally did get my food it was absolutely nothing like the first few times I had been here. The dogs then were piled with stuff and were delicious. This one had about three fries and a tiny bit of cheese sauce on it. Not gonna come back here again

btFvGhESCqLfV7T7v2NNhA.text: The food was great. The service was super slow. The fries looked like a half order. The music was TERRIBLE. With better service, more fries and a change in music...would have gotten 4+ stars.

QEZbvHAloLPb6AJgCv31lw.text: Pretty cool idea.  When you walk in, the first thing you'll notice is the upbeat, urban vibe.  It was pretty much west coast hip hop and rap the entire time we were there.  I'm not sure how this company started, but I get the feeling they used to be a food truck.  Like one of those good food trucks that has a constant line.  Food was a little more expensive than I would normally pay for hot dogs and fries, but it was extremely worth the extra couple bucks.  If you like spicy, they've got plenty of menu options for you.  My wife doesn't do spicy, and she still found something she loved.  We watched the second half of a soccer match just sitting there talking.  Good atmosphere to hang out.  They also have a pretty good beer selection if you're into that.  Overall, recommend!

xI2mLD_iaT9V-nM383NZWA.text: Flaming hot elote! If the pictures alone of their gorgeous food doesn't draw you in for a visit, then you're one unadventurous eater!   Hot Cheeto anything will surely bring me in, except when I actually tasted the elote, I sure did wish I couldn't taste the char of the grill on the corn! Really disturbed the taste! I tried with all that is within me to summon the strength to get over the taste but I couldn't! And for that reason, I vote 2 stars on the elote!  But the elote fries ....now that's another story! Delicious Cajun taste!   I'm also not going to not get street tacos since you can't really go wrong with carne Asada!   We got everything except a dirty dog! Ironic, considering the name of the establishment. Maybe next time! I'm not fully against coming back, I just wouldn't get the flaming hot elote again as wonderful as it looks, it just didn't match up in flavor! Such a shame

c7C9BOP4KNa55g1yU9iHiw.text: I hat to give a low star, but I have nothing to rate them on to eat... Have anticipated eating here for months, made the trek across the valley. Placed and paid for order, the very nice employee comes over shortly after explaining they are actually out of all vegetarian options. She was very sweet, asked if there was something else I could eat, unfortunately I do not eat meat. She did refund the full order. Only upset, scored low as "vegetarian options" is their first amenity listed after the menu on Yelp.  The staff was all 5 star for sure. Extremely professional and compassionate.

W11zBRzhFVYEmsYtJX9BVw.text: The flaming dog and elote fries are the best things on the menu period! Absolutely phenomenal. The flaming dog is spicy so if you like spicy this is what you want to order! I don't even know how to describe the taste other than amazing, you will not regret this one! The others we tried like the DUI fries, elote dog, and green dog were ehhh. The elote fries and flaming dog were an amazing duo. Highly recommend this place

fMcyvom7RKnziIFpts_k_w.text: What an awesome place! The best dog, corn, and fries I have ever had!  Ashley is the best server and made our experience even better!  She is obviously a valuable member of your team and I hope a raise in pay is in her future!

bJZ01TyOJl9J2673Mom7xQ.text: Okay.  What sort of crazy place sells hot dogs but fails to have sauerkraut. I was in the mood for simple.   Mustard and kraut.   No luck.   However as for dirty chilly or pastrami or cheese then this place rocks.  However they should consider the traditional.   Sometimes simple is best.    Fries were excellent.  Twice fried or at least they tasted like that.   Street corn was very good.   However, the biggest disappointment was the pastor taco.  It has ground beef.  WTF.  It's like they came up with an idea for left over chilly meat.   It almost took them down to 3 stars but the rest of the food was excellent and I really had to remember this was a hot dog place.   Or at last a dog without kraut place.

r88zEknKnOkLXKX9eeSrhQ.text: The only complaint about this place is the bathroom situation. One man one women. So you have to wait forever sometimes. But it's so worth it!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flamin Elote and dog

O8rXLreuRSd4CsTl0lDKtg.text: It took me a while to figure out if I like this place or not. I always got excited when I knew we were coming to eat here but some visits were a hit and other were just meh. You really need to try the menu and find out what you like and stick to those items. I've tried most of their hot dogs, tacos, corn and their dessert.  Hot dogs- they are hot or miss depending on what you like on your hot dog. Since this place is LA inspired I was hoping they would have the basic L.A street dog that I love so much. Dirt dog had one similar but it's not the same. I do notice that they put a lot of stuff on their dog and I appreciate it but sometimes all those flavors can be over powering or difficult to eat off a dog. I had the flaming dog which had hot Cheetos crumbs all over. It tasted good but the Cheetos kept falling off when I went for the bite some most of the Cheetos fell on the floor or fell in the basket but the dog is really good. I did find my favorite dog which is the dirty dog and I couldn't be happier.  Fries-I advice everyone to try the fries at this place. The carne asada fries are so good but the fries here are just so good on their own. Great texture, flavor and crisp.  Tacos- This place is not a taco shop, their tacos are ....... meh, not sure what it might be but they are not my favorite. If you are in the area and are wanting tacos I recommend these instead of going to Alberto's. Like I said , this isn't a taco shop, but I think they can make the tacos taste better to bring more people in ( not that they have issues with that, this place is always busy). I'll give their tacos a few more tries just to see what it is about them that isn't selling me or who know I might become a fan. Dessert- The desserts here are pretty good, I enjoy their churros. They also serve the churros with a cinnamon sugar cream which give it a nice taste.  Corn- their elote is good, personally I don't normally get it because they add a weird seasoning. Don't get me wrong I like the spice but here they serve it with a Cajun, cumin like seasoning and I'm not loving it. I like the traditional seasoning that the corn-man uses , you know the guy with the shopping cart. It's my preference others might really like the seasoning here but personally it's not my favorite. Drinks- They serve ALCOHOL!!! Sold! They also have agua frescas, my go to is the jamaica/hibiscus drink which is my favorite. I'll sometimes order it with milk just to just the tartness, give it a try, you might really enjoy it. Not sure if they ever serve hochata here, I think they should more often if they do, I swear my husband will be here all the time.  Locations it pretty nice, next to a few restaurants and nice neighborhood. Interior is very L.A, they love their Tupac R.I.P. Every time I'm here is reminds me of being back home in Orange County hanging out in DTSA so I love the vibe here. Great place to bring friends. The restaurant is a decent size, finding seating doesn't seems to be a problem. After eating here several times I can honestly say I'm a fan. They have good stuff, not everything is great, a few things can be hit or miss but it's definitely a place where I feel you might find your holy grail.

9ICe__EYncBI1SfC7k8I7A.text: Since we moved to Las Vegas six months ago, I've always wanted to try this place out and finally did today. If you like spicy then you'll wanna check it out for yourself. I'm definitely coming back to try other dogs on the menu.

d-RNaIB1rdC4tqqEVJheDw.text: Sad to update this review and give a lower rating. Came back today and was disappointed in my orders.  What I ordered :  Patty melt dog on a lobster roll  Dirty esquite  Churro with the horchata whipped cream  1. Patty melt was not how it usually tastes. The chipotle aioli was incredibly spicy and overpowering the whole hotdog. There was barely any cheese... how does one make a melt with no cheese? I've ordered this so many times and I'm so sad it didn't taste as good as it usually does  2. The bacon bits of disappointment and sadness. Who enjoys BURNT bacon bits? Not me.   3. The dirty esquite was okay and the churro with the whipped cream is still pretty damn good

chH3Df07-UBZd7ePOq6glw.text: My daughter turned me on to this place.  She had seen that they have an Elote Dog (maybe she saw it on Instagram not sure?) .  Anyway, she know I was going to be working in Vegas and so she assigned me the task of trying this out and reporting back.  I am happy to day it was delicious.  The other dogs look delicious too.  There is no real simple hot dog here (I assume they would do it if you asked).  Rather they are savory and spicy combinations of different things.  The bun was soft but sturdy.  The dining room is not small but not big either and filled up fast while I was there.  Food came out quickly and service was friendly.  This place is a ways off the strip if you are just visiting but worth the trip.

r3U0Jmrs51QqiGpAlGq7rw.text: Really unusual and good hotdog. I got the mutt. Wish they offered refillable drinks.... but my Mutt was delicious! Wish i had enough room in my tummy for the !

8kN29IWETNix409DU4DmFA.text: It is not centrally located, so more than likely if you're a tourist or a local, you will have a trek. It is located in a non-descript strip mall, tucked away in the back.  Near a Vietnamese take out and across from a dog resort. (Yes, you read that right. And no, the irony is not lost on me). There is not much parking. But there is an adjacent dirt lot (yes, I see that one, too), that some make use of.  But yes, this is worth the effort. Cute and worthwhile concept of gourmet hot dogs, including creations with Argentinian chimichurri or Mexican guacamole. Fries with carne asada or chili. And other concoctions, too.  Mexican corn with cheese. Prices for hot dogs are over $6. Fries run between $3-7. We spent approximately $40 for two of us.  I DIG the carne asada fries! They come with cilantro, creme, avocado, and some spicy sauce. Tasted a little more like green chili than carne asada but it was much appreciated and served with lime. Use it! Adds a delicious tangy refreshment to the fried dish.  I found the "Mutt Dog" too spicy. It is a blend of their "Red Dog" (really spicy) and "Green Dog" (purportedly not spicy). But it tends toward more of the Red Dog, so I was reaching for my Hibiscus (called "Jamaica", pronounced "HI-Myka") drink to cool down. Try it. Also, they have the real sugar "Mexican" Coca-Colas, which are subtly different from the regular American cokes which are made with high fructose corn syrup. (If you have a refined palate, yes, you will taste the difference, and the Mexican one is better).  The horchata ice cream and churro is a nice finish, especially if you ordered a spicy dog. It is a little thick, but big enough to share. My only criticism of this is it should have had more of the nuts and rice Krispy toppings, and maybe a bigger or more churros. The ratio was a little bit off.  Service is terrific. Friendly order person and server. Yes! Felt like I was in a real service town, like LA or New York. You order and pay at the cashier (order person), but have the food brought out to you, and cleared by a hard-working, friendly server. ANISHA, you rock! Great smile and super attentive service!  Speaking of which, the venue is trendy, with photos and murals of Los Angeles ("City of", with colorful angel wings). A map of Clark County displays yellow tags to show how far you came to "get dirty." Ask to post where YOU came from in the city to this little out of the way place. The music is 90s Hip-Hop. Surprised to see how family friendly this place is! Despite how trendy (and surreal portraits of Tupac, Ice Cube, and Kobe Bryant, for example), whole families come in, with little kids in tow.

FXspEXWDq2xRoB5xalCJsw.text: I'll be honest, for a good 3 days, my other half and I ate dirt dogs for dinner. Its absolutely delicious. I thought the topping would be too much but it actually all goes very well together. They have very tasty dogs that we love. We always get our dogs on a lobster bun because its so buttery and better than an ordinary hot dog bun. We have tried "the mutt" and "the elote" hotdogs and they were so good! Our goal is to try the whole menu and so far, everything taste great!

ekX3OKJ2g3rZVwAlokRk2g.text: So, first of all, let me say how amazing this place is... I don't eat pork and most of the time hot dogs have some sort of porc in them and to my delight, this place had vegan hot dogs!! I got the flamingo dog which had flaming Cheetos and corn on top, we also ordered the corn fries which were soooo good! I honestly recommend this place if you are craving a good loaded hot dog!

PYujAvuKSX_N7pABIR686A.text: So good!!!!!! Worth all of the hype and calories. Want to come back and try more.   The Flaming Dog with the hot Cheetos, elote, bacon bits, corn, cilantro..... heavenly. Hot and delicious. Pastrami dog was ALSO delicious, coming straight from the mouths of people who don't even usually eat pastrami. Also got the elote (MUST get) and the carne asada fries.   Nothing is too expensive considering how much food is presented to you. It's a lot. The dawgs themselves are like the size of a baby's arm.   Also tons of unique beers and IPAs on tap!!! And a wall of hot sauce. Winner winner.

-e0NpKROnqcBdjor3t6nIQ.text: have tried almost all the dog places in Vegas but ALWAYS come back to Dirt Dog.  The atmosphere is fun the staff are fun and the food is fun AND delish!!!

5qVObrna03PQRxpCV4pouQ.text: One of my favorite places in Vegas to eat. They are know for their "Dirty" bacon-wrapped hot dogs with all types of delicious toppings. Today I had the Pastrami dog on a lobster roll and elote fries, SO GOOD! There so much flavor- I've never had anything like it. Same with the elote fries, the fries are fried perfectly and they don't get soggy, crunchy outside with a soft inside. It looks really cool, there's a map of Vegas on one wall and you put a flag marker on your neighborhood. There's also a a hot sauce wall with about 50 different kinds. The playlist is always good- old skool hip-hop. Great vibe!

C57YNOckFLA5Nx9JBuWz6w.text: Great food, great service, will come again.  Ordered dirty chili dog, garlic fries, and green dog.  My kid got the corn dog kid meal.   Seating was hard to find. A family left and disintegrated bus their table, so the nice staff did for us. No problem.  We got our food. Dirty chili was great and spicy. Garlic fires were subtle and hot.  The corn dogs were awesome and it came with cookies.  My youngest devoured the fries.   Great service...the cleaners came over twice to check on us.   Will come back. Oh and catchy music in the back. All sorts of people here and all welcome.

JtODyHBTlgiXIrNFvQqgDA.text: So happy to find out what the hype was all about! I now know why everyone raves about this place.   Decor is awesome and love the playlist. Definitely a crowded place so you have to find a table quick!   They have so many different options, who knew you could make a hotdog so many different ways. I got the elote dog, best thing ever. A little messy so don't wear your favorite clothes that day. Also got the garlic fries, fresh garlic on the top, so excellent.    The staff was all super friendly, and I was happy to see they had Stella cidre on tap! Definitely will be back for more!
