Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of corn minus the chili for my 11 month old baby

FtqZVpMTk7kPdPpPktQdxA.text: Great concept we need more you guys got it going on great music great food and super friendly staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some art on the wall

OfLTcqkIFRnTbGaTk3tgig.text: Unimpressed. Ate at Dirt Dog for the first time today, and while the hot dogs are fairly good, they're not anywhere near worth the $7 price tag. The service was painfully slow - and you order at a counter as you walk in. There was one other family in line and it took around 15 minutes for us to just place our order. Esquite was good, but again grossly overpriced, and the stupid expensive chili fries were soggy and bland. Will not be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soggy, bland chili fries

bVj2SRvRx9zZQ6wFD3Ug7g.text: I've wanted this concept in Hawaii for a decade! Great tasting dogs and sides as well. Great beer selection too.

lGMzACVHiKpJp9iqeURHCA.text: Love this place so much! I'm not a big fan of hotdogs, but this place is something else! Their hotdogs are sooo flavorful and juicy! So delicious! I always get the Elote Dog and it's amazing!! & You'll get full off one hotdog! Definitely worth it!

XTcPtJ7c0i9xaSSWQSQsFQ.text: Cashier was super friendly and helpful!  The food was amazing! Can't wait to come back! :D

DRl7uAM4U3ut2ikK-GX0AA.text: I can appreciate that they have a veggie option because initially the hubby saw them on Yelp and told me about it but started by saying: you can't eat there but this place sounds good...   I had a vegetarian dog with a mixture of the green and red sauce with the lobster roll all the recommendation of the employee who was very helpful. YUM! The red sauce is pretty spicy and I like spice!   *disclamer for vegetarians, they make the veggie ones as ordered so it may take a while for yours.  Give the register guy a heads up if you're still looking at the menu but know for sure you're gonna get the veggie dog.    Their house made chips are bomb. The dirty fries are delicious and the sauce that comes with the garlic fries is really tasty.   The group before us bought all of the corn so it was a 30 minute wait for the next batch of corn to be roasted. We ended up staying long enough to get the cup of corn which was a nice (but kinda random) side dish.   Hubbs and his mom also enjoyed their hot dogs. I forget the one that the hubby got but he said it kinda tasted like a hamburger and that the bacon bits are legit. His mom had the teriyaki one that she gobbled up too. The menu isn't huge but I think it's enough to not be overwhelmed with choices. We will be back for sure, everything we had was good!

PJWILBp0WAg-Z4T1GE6jBQ.text: You can say for certain this is a taste of California street food truck style recipes. Came in for my first dirt dog with my lady, the presentation is on point every thing that you order comes out looking like what they named it to the T. For me I guess I have had better hotdogs. It just seemed like the hotdog itself was extremely salty so any of the condiments or garnish you could possibly order you can't truly taste due to the saltiness. The idea is one of a kind I give 5 stars for creativity but the taste counts too! For example all I could taste on the Elote Dog was the cotija cheese and high amounts of sodium, usually corn is sweet  it was like extra filler corn very bland.

Ft5cBLhZ8_5C0ahfb4rfAA.text: Been here twice already, I love the elote hotdog! Also the garlic fries are really good. They always have a nice crowd in there, very popular. Friendly service and clean restaurant.

pZxev8aQzoYTCD0kpb88Ig.text: service was 4 out of 10. didnt feel warm and welcome as a new comer at all. their dogs are overpriced and overrated. probably on lly delicious in the state it originally was born in?

HBVfwBbjoOGAPA7uAixUcg.text: My boyfriend and I walked in around four. The middle of the evening. I don't know about him but I was expecting a few people to be in there. Little did I know that when we did walk in, the place was completely empty. The only physical person we saw was one guy in the back in the kitchen area. I noticed that guy did glance at us but he didn't greet us until my boyfriend waved his hands in the air. We stood in the front scoping the menu for about ten minutes until a lady walked out from the back and told us "She would be right with us." We we're in no rush so we didn't mind. It felt like another five minutes flew by until our order we finally taken. We were just questioning why it took so long to order and wondered if they just opened cause it looked like they were still preparing for the day.   When it came to the food, I got the Dirty Chili Dog. Right when it got served to me, I was very excited. The sauce was dripping down the bun and it overall looked stuffed. First bite, was outstanding! I got a taste of the flavors including the bacon bits. It was not until the middle of the dog that I realized that the bottom half of my bun was sort of hard. The only reason I didn't catch it right away was because the dog itself was covered in sauce. Other than that, my hot dog was pretty good. Not bad at all.   My boyfriend tried the tacos! $2 dollars a taco, he begs to differ. Out of the three tacos, he realized one of his tacos were cold. But the rest were like warm. Those were his only complaints about the tacos but overall they were pretty decent.   Would we come back to this place? Sure, if we were in the area and it was one of our last resort. This place was not bad at all.

4H8JPEyjAlgS8g2ms_8tDA.text: Amazing food. I dont usually eat hot dogs but i could eat theirs everyday. Corn on the cop is stupid delicious as well. I live 20miles away from them but I dont even mind drive over there. Also Decent selection of beer and kind staffs are plus. Although waitline can be super long but its worth it to wait

J6ahQoKv09k2YGdZ6u_SJw.text: New to Las Vegas and wanted to try something different and this place is AWESOME! Real Elote dog and the staff was awesome! I wasn't 100% in love with the garlic fries but I would order them again! Definitely worth the trip.

IG4hBOiTJiW1f1z1duOw9A.text: After coming here for an elite event I fell head over heels in love with the Elote Dog and was in need of another visit. I brought the boo along this time and we came on a Saturday around 1 pm. The seating can fill up pretty quickly, but luckily we were able to grab a spot. I love the vibe, super chill and lots of Tupac.   This time around I also tried the garlic fries. I thought the taste of the fries were ok, but they were just missing some type of delicious dipping sauce. (3/5) The Elote Dog, my one True love, was just as good as I remembered. (5/5) You HAVE to get the lobster bun, it's so freaking good and no it doesn't actually have lobster in or on it.   I wish this place wasn't so far from my house, but maybe it's a good thing since I'd definitely be broke and 20 lbs heavier.

UgQsuDZzufQDcl7af1cN7Q.text: So finally decided to try this joint and it didn't live up to my expectation. I mean every one has their own taste but as far as for mine, it was just an okay.   Me and wifey tried the green dog and the brown dog with both lobster bread. The hot dog and the mix that goes along with it are okay, the bread was very good though. Its a one time quitter for me. I like the hotdogs with bacon wrapped around them at fahion district in L.A. again my personal preference.  Staff was friendly and place was pretty neat.

MpWFrOIR8tAyC1YXtTetXg.text: Killer pastrami dog with sat and pepper fries. Worth the drive over friendly staff cool atmosphere.

553XhUuvp1pbYjVJvgtQxg.text: Fellow past So-Cal residents; ATTENTION. Are you feeling homesick? Do you love Elote inspired street dogs? Wanna cool off from the dry, Vegas heat with an ice cold beer or aguas frescas? LOOK NO FURTHER! Dirtdog LV is a LA-themed hotspot! Bite into an explosion of nostalgia while your favorite Tupac jam bumps through the speakers. Dirtdog LV now open throughout Sin City

qrlVWA98qPTm_xtxZhYrpw.text: Food was mediocre. Of all the things I ordered, the fried Oreos were the best. The hot corn was my least favorite. Wouldn't go out of my way to come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot corn
Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red dog
Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Oreos

GiYd9NccBiFAVGLWuk10Gw.text: I absolutely love it here! I've only had one miscommunication, but they were really busy that day & I like to consider myself pretty understanding. I almost always get the elote dog (I'd recommend any of their hot dogs on a lobster roll, totally worth the extra $0.50) with filthy fries because it's just so good! The staff here is super nice and chill. I love that they have board/card games you can play while you wait for your food and/or eat!   The overall ambiance is fun and laid back, the food is great, the games are fun, but some things at Dirt Dog can be a bit pricey for those eating on a budget. I usually only go with one other person and we end up spending around $30, including drinks.  Dirt Dog is definitely one of my favorite places to get my grub on! It's totally on my list of restaurants when anybody asks me where they can get some good food with a fun ambiance! If you're craving something "dirty", go hit this place up!

1SVJzlz2TbqxjCU_BgrMwg.text: I love dirt dog! This is my second visit here and I still love it. The first time I came here was during the Yelp Elite event. This time, I brought my family here and they loved it! Food is always made to order, which is fantastic! Food is delicious! Well seasoned! I believe we came during the weekend and they had one person at the register. The line was getting long to the point the next party that came through the door didn't know where to form a line.  I suggest they take orders at the tables for those dining in and keeping the register for take outs only.

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Patty melt dog
Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dirty chili fries

3OuZEaXaRmjLwJUg2U1jjw.text: We drove across all of Vegas.and was not disappointed at all. The Esquire and the corn and fries were great, surely we will be back.

6EBjIGwAxCJ89MCW712ckQ.text: Where has this place been my whole life!!! I love food trucks and this place give you the feel of that. The decor is really cool almost like a tattoo shop. I saw angel wings which is inspiring my new tattoo. Not to mention all the Tupac music, I was in heaven. The food did not disappoint either. I wanted to try everything on the menu! I decided on the Red Dog with sweet bun, elote corn, and horrchata ice cream. Everything was delicious the Red Dog had just enough spice with the red flakes on top. The corn was good and off the cob just like I like it. Ice cream hit the right spot after my entree. The service was quick and friendly.  I will be back when my hot dog craving hits again!

FaPeBkIdm2Y1_iUHVFvVRQ.text: My lady friend and I came in here earlier this evening for dinner, and let me tell ya the hot dogs, or should I say dirty dogs did not disappoint!  I got the patty melt dog on a lobster roll and she got the ranchero dog on a regular bun and trust me it really hit the spot, plus neither of us had eaten all day and it filled us up so that's a plus! We also got the carneasada fries which were odd... I mean the fries were great, the meat was great, but together something seemed a little off. The more we ate it the more we questioned whether or not we really enjoyed them.   However 5 stars solely for the hot excuse me I mean dirty dogs! We will definitely be back and we look forward to trying their desserts which looked bomb to say the least!

( I'm from LA) it's like getting a hot dog from a street vendor after a long night of dancing my butt off except kicked up like ten knotches!!!!  It's a really weird location so if you don't know what to look for it you would never see it! Plus they play amazing music! It was nothing but West Coast hip-hop from Tupac, Snoop, Dre and a few others sprinkled in there! I got the Elote Dog and the patty melt dog! Yum and for desert a fried Twinkie and homemade churro! Plus they have Cherry Coke on fountain! Nobody ever has cherry Coke! I can't wait to take all the people I know to this gem!

rnqXA2UUSWSUzLR2NM-8Eg.text: My hubby insist we stop here, he's heard a lot about this place and there's 2 locations here in Vegas and the one on the strip is pretty packed so we drove 20mins off the strip to this one here. It's in an area that is newly built and we almost missed this place! It's hidden in the corner of this plaza area.  Wow the elote in a cup is awesome. We ordered 6 dogs between the two of us.  Told the hubby thats too much but he wanted to make sure we tried them all. We got the elote dog, dirty chili dog, house dog, red dog and honestly can't remember the last two. The ones I wasn't a fan of was the elote dog and one that had too much mayo on. The elote was better as a side cup and the one with with mayo, well too much mayo.  Now my hubby can say we came here. They do have good hot dogs and definitely get the elote in a cup, so worth it.

Super slow service for a $6 hot dog and $3.25 for garlic fries.  The dog was good but not $6 good.  I don't think I will return and probably can't recommend spending $11 for a dog and fries to my friends.  And if you don't like rap or hip hop you'll hate it here.

_6rZXVJojgrgYr0Is1HLFw.text: The mintute i stepped into this place i fell in love with the vibe. They have the dirtiest hotdogs, the best fries and awesome horchata. Plus they have 90s hip hop playing, which i enjoy.  If your from L.A. , you'll absolutely love this place just as much as i did.

_cqFxVh-ehCqKubCXUpXqg.text: Great new place in Las Vegas! I went there on July 4th and this is really a hidden gem.  To begin, this place is conveniently located on Rainbow Blvd right between Blue Diamond Road and 215 so it is really easy to access. There is also plenty of parking. The place is reasonably big and wasn't packed at all when I went there.  This place offers specialty hot-dogs for $5.95 and sides (Fries, corn, etc...) and desserts (Deep-Fried twinkies, oreos, and churros, etc...) for $2.95. But this place becomes even more interesting with their beer selection. Dirt Dog offers a rotating selection of craft beers that are absolutely amazing. Whether you like light or dark beers, citrus or grapefruit flavored beers, expect to find something you like there! Jesse was instrumental in introducing all these beers to us and making us have a great time there.   The atmosphere there is great and they even had a DJ and free cotton candy that day! In the end, I would definitely recommend this place as a must try in the Las Vegas area if you like hot-dogs and great craft beers. Feel free to message me for any additional details that you may need!

aL1sm1wTh0dHQ4_2pDt9Cw.text: Stopped in after seeing some Instagram photos of the new Flamin' Hot Cheetos elote! As soon as we walked in, Tupac was playing and we immediately loved the vibe inside this hidden gem. Myself and another ordered the Patty Melt Dog on Texas toast, and a friend ordered the Elote Dog. The Patty Melt dog was to die for!! It was wrapped in bacon, topped with cheddar cheese fries and a chipotle aioli. Our friend said his elote dog was also delicious, the perfect balance between sweet & savory. We each ordered an elote, I got the classic Dirty Corn which did not skimp on the cotija cheese or yummy spices. We also ordered both of the new elote (not on the menu, it's the "secret menu" as the cashier told us). One was a Cheesy Cheeto elote, rolled in Cheetos and topped with melted cheddar cheese. The other was the Flamin' Hot Cheeto elote, rolled in Hot Cheetos and topped with melted cheddar cheese. Both were OUT OF THIS WORLD. They have soda in glass bottles, a good selection of beer, and did I mention Fried Twinkies?! We will definitely be back!!

Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Classic Elote (aka Dirty Corn)
Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flamin&#39; Hot Cheetos Elote

BIyvJePNVqHc2xwsu2yujQ.text: The Hot dogs at this place are very enjoyable and reasonably priced. It is gourmet hot dogs not your typical Polish dogs from Costco so you should expect to pay a little bit more. The servers were very nice and friendly, once you have finished placing your order, pick a table and they will bring the food to you.  I really enjoyed the food, but I wish they had a little bit more variety to choose from. The hotdog was huge, and the toppings really added to the flavor. The only thing I didn't quite enjoy was the dirty corn esquite elote because it was a lot smaller than what was pictured.

v9Qc2Q7t26b2UZze9RoxRQ.text: This place is not for the weak of heart... that can really have two meanings lol.  Be prepared to get dirty.  The name doesn't lie. This place is full of messy deliciousness.    I say this often, but being from NY I'm a food-snob about certain foods and hot dogs are definitely one of those items.  This place is legit!  I got the House Dog, the Red Dog and the Dirty Fries.    Both hot dogs were flavor explosions.  First off, one hot dog is a enough.  I ordered two because it was my cheat day and I couldn't decide, so I ate half of each.    The house dog with the bacon thousand island? Are you kidding me? Bacon Thousand Island? Then... more bacon? Soooooo good!  The Red dog just had such great flavor... smokey from the chipotle and some kick from the chili sauce...oh yeah, more bacon!  Can't pick a favorite here.  The only True winner was me since I got to try both.  The fries were solid, but I couldn't make my way through all of them.    They also have an impressive little beer list with a couple of nice craft beers.  This place is about twenty minutes from me, but it's worth the drive for another cheat day.

jpnObLbBkKwY9BnO2i9YMg.text: Their speciality hotdogs and crispy fries were delicious!!! They also had a decent beer variety. Our family was served promptly and everyone enjoyed their food. Trevor was extremely helpful during our visit, but the whole staff was terrific!!! We'll definitely be visiting again!!!

eKaBAyluz8QrjmoNOhEorg.text: We had always been curious about dirt dog. This place is always Poppin. So finally, we did. Man, were we happy to have gone in and checked out. The food is delish. We ordered the pastrami dog (now my fav), the carne asada tacos (Mr J's fave now) and the dirty esquite. They have a great selection of beers on tap (Elysian Space Dust ftw), and super nice employees. Josh is our fave. If you ever come in with him, expect to great service

Wf8NxySfmtXOhD_gSnC0BA.text: Don't get the fries!!! Came to this place for date night. The setting was cool. You came in, ordered, get your drinks and sit down. The music was hip hop from the 90s. There was great photo art on the walls of the hip hop legends. The menu looked amazing. I ended up ordering the Mutt (it was half and half...thought it would be a great way of tasting two hotdogs), garlic fries, and the Mexican street corn on the cob...I forget their name for it. So the corn came out first. It was really good. The only thing that was over the top for me is the bacon crumbles. I've NEVER seen that before. It wasn't terrible, I just like my corn the way it is supposed to come. The corn was still very good and I will definitely order it again. The hot dog and fries came next. I will get the fries out of the way. They started out 'okay'. I LOVE a good basket of fries topped with things and I was really leaning towards the Carne Asada fries or the corn fries, but since I was getting corn and a hot dog, I decided on the garlic fries since I also love garlic. The fries quickly went downhill as they were dripping in oil. They said all the fries are like that. They needed to be drained for a little while longer or something. I couldn't finish them because they were so gross and mad that I kept trying. Now on to the main event...the hot dog. The hot dog was good...yes. It was amazing...agree. It had a nice bite..like when you bite into a good hotdog, it shouldn't 'melt' and this one stood up under all of the stuff piled on top. The bread was perfectly toasted. The hot dog is a home run. I would give this place 3 stars because of the fries were that gross, but the hot dog, corn, and ambiance brought it back up to a solid 4 or even a 4.5. Just don't get the fries .

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The fries with the pool of oil
Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Mutt and the garlic fries
Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican street corn

DHYmUbwbhFBFs-hJB8qspg.text: This place is tucked away on South of the 215 on Rainbow in between Blue Diamond and Windmill area on the East side by The Lodge. This is a clean and fantastic place. A must try for all of us "foodies".

k02tUffUAbSpfKHEDbj4Ng.text: I've been wanting to try this place ever since they opened. I live all the way by red rock and haven't made it yet, so my mom and I were on this side of town, I suggested we try it. The staff is super friendly and helped me with ordering. There are a lot of choices, which I love. They have different choices of fries, dogs, desserts, tacos and drinks. I chose to get the veggie dog and my mom got the house dog and we also decided to try the elote  fries. They messed up our meal, but gave us the dog for free that they messed up on which was really nice of them. Everything was super delicious. I want to come back and definitely try the hot Cheetos elote. The decor was cool, music was on point, I will definitely be back. The only thing I wish they had was turkey dogs. I understand not everyone or a lot of people eat them, but I don't eat red meat or pig, and a turkey dog would've been amazing. The soy dog was ok, but turkey would've been good too. Either way, I'll be back.

_3Mny_13K4Zh41SfxMaSsQ.text: Great place for a cheat day. Don't come here expecting healthy choices. I like the twists they make on their hot dog. I love everything they have on the menu. -tfFw2bt7GZwp_04fNtUbg.text: We just tried this place for lunch today. It was amazing. The atmosphere is upbeat and fun. There is definitely a theme here which doesn't really mirror anywhere else in town. I like it. The environment is not random, it's definitely thought out.   The young man at the counter who took our order, was great! He was top notch from start to finish. He made suggestions, tried his hand at upselling, and complimented our choices... and he wasn't wrong. Everything was so good.   Definitely recommend for a better than average hot dog and quick lunch experience.

Ut2NktnGWIlep1m8GL-5Xg.text: Tiny dog joint featuring bacon wrapped hot dogs, elotes (Mexican street corn) and fries to die for. Do yourself a favor and don't miss it.

ZHiipVrsLw1BZMD4FduqcA.text: Good But Pricey If you remember Cheeseburger Cheeseburger , this is where it used to be . My son and I really liked it , but hated the parking lot . Anyway onto the new dog in the house .  First thing the employees were nice and the place was clean . 90's Hip Hop playin' , but not loud , Hip Hop Hooray . The decor is a little sparse , but it is a hot dog place . I got the House Dog on a Lobster Roll , Dirty Chili Fries , and Aqua Fresca for $17.05 , a little much .   The fries were really good and cooked just right and next time I want to get the corn . The hotdog was average size not a footlong or sausage , but wrapped in bacon . I like the peppers on it and the lobster roll was toasted just right . It was good , not great , but filling . I will try again and get that corn , it looks so good .

DAquKZJ-00TODzLzOaUv2A.text: Jayden is the best!! Me and husband came to eat here for lunch, the best place ever! Love the interior designs and the creative hot dogs. I first ordered a house dog, I wasn't really a fan of mustard but Jayden described what was in it. I then got my hot dog and wasn't really a fan of the mustard, I felt so bad because she did tell me there was a lot of sauce in it. So my husband ate his elote dog and the house dog while I ordered another elote dog. I felt bad. Jayden turned it around and threw in another two fried Oreos with such superb service!!!! She needs to be promoted! She had a great smile as well and made me feel welcomed! Also the server with the red cornroll braids was such a sweetheart. I thanked them in advance. Great place to eat also the hot sauce wall is so cool and very great for an ideal hot dog place! Really awesome vibes here! Even beer was great!! Will def come back again with more people! Thanks Dirt dog!!!!

kuvR9saADx7jU3TM6hYNZg.text: I love hotdogs! This place has really good hot dogs. They could serve a plain hotdog and I'd go for that many times. I like that they have great tap beers and the cashier commented that he appreciates me exercizing my 2A rights and Nevada open carry (hurray for free states). I tried Dirty Fries and the hotdog that is like Mexican street corn (in fact it has corn in it) but the name escapes me at the moment. I definitely like the crazy flavor profiles of the fries and on the dog. I like that you can choose your bun, I like the lobster bun. There is nothing I don't like about the place. I'm glad it's 8 miles away or I'd be 500lbs! I definitely have to try all the rest of the dogs and fries, but the service and what I've tried so far have been awesome. I really do wish they had a plain hotdog option. Of course they might but I didn't look all that well.

Not disappointed though, very tasty, wish i had more time to eat in but maybe next time, so yes ill be back. Thank you Dirt Dog, see ya next time

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green Dog, My Lunch

GKvspdoubuO15-pL3Igdrw.text: Although I enjoy their food as stated before, I am still running into issues each time I visit. This time, I placed a phone order which I have done since visiting this establishment (over a year and a half). I normally order one or two items and with a toddler it is easier to call before to avoid long wait times. Upon arriving, I stood off the the side (at second cash register) as I have done in the past and have seen others do, only to be informed that even though I placed a phone order I would need to stand in the regular line (which we all know, is never short or quick.)   After standing in line, I asked the employee at the register, when they started implementing having to wait in the regular line for a phone order, and was informed that it has "always been that way." Honestly at that point I wasn't surprised that I was questioned if I had ordered at the right place since they couldn't find my order as my name or number wasn't taken over the phone.   Food is great but honestly not worth the trouble as I ALWAYS run into something when I order from this establishment.  If you do choose to go, make sure you go with plenty of time and don't go if you are in a rush.

CQyTDOBLEiihtELyeYzqaw.text: Went here yesterday for the first time and I think they had all my cravings in one place!! I got the Carne Asada fries, fried Oreos, Dirty Esquite (elote corn in a cup basically) and my Fiance got one of the hot dogs. The Carne Asada fries are probably the best ones I've ever had, because the fries were so crispy! Even with all the toppings on them. I didn't finish them all and was able to take them home later and they were still crispy! The fried Oreos were amazing, I should've ordered more of them, since there are only two in each order. This place was bomb. We were in the area yesterday and decided to try it, but we are going to make the drive out here again just to eat here!

K-cCESpPGZXPopi1ujySvQ.text: Tried this place when I was in Vegas and it's soooo bomb! The food is so different and I'm such a picky eater but I loved everything I ate here! Will def be back next time I'm in vegas

cafFQyxd8MdmhyY7YXLhDw.text: Came in after work feening for some hot dogs. This place definitely comes thru with the street dog flavor. Service was dope. Cashiers are cool.  I ate the elote dog, and the red dog. Red dog was slightly sweet with a nice spicy flavor. Hot dog texture was perfect, and bun wasn't oily. Thumbs up here. The elote dog was tangy, sweet, and very savory. I also sampled the mutt dog and the dirty chilli dog. Out of the four, my favorite so far is the chilli dog. Fries came out crisp and a little oily at the bottom. They were lightly salted as well. Garlic fries use minced garlic and not powder. You get really nice bites.  Super worth.  If you need to eat hot dogs, this is a dope spot.  Will eat again!!

_NHOZvC3iKqfsiVVu7C-rg.text: Their hot dogs are very good for an affordable price.  Now they have multiple options for French fries which all look lit.  They have street tacos which are very tasty.  The employees here are very phenomenal.        Mgmt did an excellent job with picking employees that have a positive attitude and they always suggestively upsell which is smart business.   I ordered some food here last week but my order wasn't correct when I got home.  I called and the person on the phone took my name/number down and said they would give me the same order on dirt dog's dime.  That was extremely professional and truly impressive customer service.  You guys are doing a great job and it is very busy now compared to a few years ago

ddTM7XP9eFUX20PrML6RCg.text: Had to stand in line for 15 minutes so I had plenty of time to hear the saga of the sign from last night that said, Out Of Pastrami Dogs not being taken down. People were trying to order them and 24 hours later the cashier with the green lipstick (WTF??) still hadn't gotten the word. The customers were arguing with her and the sign was still up, so she had to go check. Added another 2 minutes to my wait.   So when I finally got to order my garlic fries to go, Green Lips didn't tell me until AFTER I paid that there was going to be a wait for them because they "just had a big order". I asked how long, and she said 12 minutes. Had I known, I'd have walked, but maybe she suspected that and that's why she didn't tell me until it was too late.   So, 30 minutes out of my life for garlic fries. Admittedly they were good, and I originally gave Dirt Dog 3 stars for that reason. But writing this review got me all reeled up again and I'm taking away a star. Take that, you Dirty Dirt Dog!

b8NXnFTVsRfTH3BlEsIR5g.text: Had the Mutt, house dog, green dog, garlic fries, dirty corn esquite   Overall flavor across the board was average, the all beef hot dogs flavor were decent. The garlic fries looked a little sad, nothing like the picture on the menu in store. The mutt dog was fairly spicy, kind of a one note dog. The bun was just ok. The dirty corn was one of the better things we had. Service was excellent, very friendly. Unfortunately as hot dog joints go this one wasn't quite up to snuff.

4pOC-i-f_nZX2_YbHepUaQ.text: Everytime we've been here for dinner, it's always been amazing! Love the little games they have to play while we wait for our food. It helps us put our phones down so that we actually interact with each other.

Take a seat anywhere and just relax.   It's always a good experience here, I always love ordering a full meal as in a hot dog, fries, elote, a dessert and a drink. It's not terribly priced you get what you pay for.  The only thing I would caution about is the garlic fries are deadly and they aren't so unique. Just tons of minced and juiced garlic with fries, it's nothing special I wouldn't order it again.   Order your hot dog on a lobster roll you won't be disappointed!

pR0qTftq7UB6LxD4o-Vsww.text: Came with a few friends for dinner. The place is tucked away in an obscure showing center but once you open the door it's very cute. w-lz2g8ElzCaIsZQUkhWmA.text: Oh. My. God. I cannot say enough good about this establishment. My husband and I were searching for a place to eat for dinner on a Friday night, and we came across Dirt Dog online. It was 12 miles from us, but the reviews were overwhelmingly positive and it had been a while since we'd had a good hot dog; so we made the drive across town. We walked in around 7 PM, and the line was nearly out the door. We thought about coming back another time, but we had already driven all the way across town, so we stayed. And thank the good lord above that we did. The line moved much faster than we expected; and once we ordered, they had our food at our table in approximately 6 minutes - which was astounding, considering how busy they were.   We ordered two hot dogs, an order of dirty fries, and a churro with HORCHATA WHIPPED CREAM *screams internally*. This only set us back $23 (not bad for a Friday night dinner, in my humble opinion). Their Portuguese bread is perfectly sweet, and pairs wonderfully with the sweet corn and lime mayo on the Enote Dog; and the lobster bread (more buttery, and $0.50 more) was also very delicious and tasted splendid with the House Dog.   Needless to say we devoured our food - every bite of which was absolutely incredible. We will most certainly be coming back. A 12 mile drive is a small price to pay for one of the best hot dogs in the city.

p9bRPgbv76LTFjloq2c_CQ.text: Finally had the opportunity to come in and see what they had to really offer.. since the only time i saw them was during a foodie event.. coming in you really feel that California vibe seeing all the decor on the walls (graffiti) and the music playing.. (hip hop / rap)..   I was pretty bummed out when i found out that they had ran out of corn.. which i was really craving for.. and kinda upsetting since it was lunch time on a Saturday (you figure that more people will go and eat there on the weekend right?) - but i guess it was that good.. or a possible error on someone's part.. regardless.. i had something else..  wait time was a little bit long but bearable... once i received my order i went straight to my car and started chowing down... i was overwhelmed with how salty everything was.. and i needed to drink something every time i had a bite.. hopefully they fix this.. or ask for less salt..   im sure ill return in hopes they have corn next time around..

XJk48jNbUXpmuOeL5gQJog.text: THAT HOTCHATA SPREAD THOUGH.   Ive been wanting to check out Dirt Dog after seeing pictures all over IG. I knew they had an LA location so I was excited to see that they opened one here in Vegas.   Came here on a Saturday night around 5 pm. We started off with some elotes aka "dirty corn." The elote was bomb dot com, spread with lime infused mayo and butter compote and topped with cotija cheese, cilantro, and chili powder! With every bite, I could taste all the ingredients. It was so flavorful, and I don't remember enjoying corn as much as I did here.   We tried a few of their hot dogs which included the Red Dog, Green Dog, Mutt Dog, and the House Dog. My favorite was the Mutt Dog, which is half Green Dog and half Red Dog. The Green Dog is topped with their homemade guac, chimichurri sauce, onions, bell peppers, and lime, while the Red Dog comes with a spicy tomato chile and chipotle aioli sauce. Besides all the fresh toppings and condiments, what makes these hot dogs so great is that all the sausages come bacon wrapped and placed in a lobster bun. The lobster bun adds some sweetness and butteriness to the hot dog and another level of awesome altogether.   The fries were also really good, perfectly crisp and crunchy. The Filthy Fries were straight up filthy (in positive terms). The cheddar sauce was freakin amazing, and I wanted to spread it all over my hot dog. Talking about spread, I gotta come back to that horchata spread. Oh man, the desserts here are off the charts! I would come back just for the desserts alone. The fried Oreos were to die for along with the fried Twinkie. The batter was killer, and it was the best fried oreo I've ever had. They both came with this Horchata whipped cream, and I don't wanna hype it, but that Horchata spread was so damn good that I wanted to shed a tear.   The entire staff was super friendly, and big ups to Tiffany for her excellent service and explaining every single dish down to all the nitty gritty details.   Excellent food and superior service. Doesn't get better than that. Dirt Dog is a place you do not want to miss here in Vegas.

4FDTNTsSdphqk77axiDPGg.text: The atmosphere for the restaurant is super chill. It has a lot of sitting and its set up like a "diner". The service there was great and they were super attentive. The cashier went through the whole menu with us when we told him that we had never been there. The food came out super quickly as well. They have hot dogs, fries, and tacos. We only got the tacos and fries though.   Elote Fries: The fries were crispy and golden. They put a lot of cheese on the top and there was corn and bacon mixed in with the fries. The fries were decent, but I probably wouldn't order them again.   The House dog and dirty chili dog: All the hot dogs come wrapped in bacon, which adds a lot of flavor.  Overall, the hot dogs were okay. Definitely not the best hot dog I have ever eat, but it wasn't bad. A bit overpriced for one hot dog though.

ptyWr-UFwzJUfNyNX0Bqmw.text: Wow. Yeah I know you might be thinking a hot dog is a hot dog. Nope not here! They have master this little piggy . I've been here twice and I was so pleased.  I don't eat meat but once every other month or so I might decided to indulged in some animal protein. Boy am I happy I picked this place. I ordered the house Dog. No belly issues either. The place is clean and very hype. Mixed crowd with old, young, family's, hipsters a little bit of everyone. The decor fits. It reminds me of being back home in Cali. LA style.. They have music playing too.  ORDER ON YOUR WAY THERE! There WILL be a long line.  Think about in and out...  They offer several types of bread for the dog. I opted for the butter toast. Omg!! Yes! The fries were crispy and delicious too. My husband said  his dog was perfect. So this is a gem guys. Go and get your hot dog on.. 5 stars

8ulLXiEd1gI7mC3IU_hitg.text: DIRT DOG IS F***ING AMAZING!   Tucked away in a small retail plaza on Rainbow just north of Blue Diamond, Dirt Dog offers some bomb-ass hot dogs, fries, and fried desserts.   The space is actually quite bigger than you'd expect, and they're actually not that busy...probably in part due to the remoteness of their location (but that's perfectly okay by me).   Get the Dirty Chili Dog. It's the best dog they offer. Bun, bacon-wrapped dog, hearty meaty chili (no beans), cheese, onions, cilantro, and chili aioli. Perfection. The chili has spice, but not heat. And if you can manage to get that perfect bite of everything together, you'll be a customer for like.  The second-best product Dirt Dog offers is the Deep-Fried Oreos. Seriously. You need these in your life. They offer the perfect contrast to everything you just experienced with your Dirty Chili Dog. They're not overly-battered or greasy, they're sweet, warm, and the perfect texture.   You NEED Dirt Dog in your life. Next time you're nearby, give it a go. You won't regret it. In fact, you'll probably be back next week.

otJ117KaaY2S7y7lFLiM0Q.text: Hands-down one of the best hotdog spots in Vegas it putsPinks to shame. They really have a lot of good menu items to pick from, their tacos are so so stick with the hotdogs and their fries!

CAUwc9QPE7hCTOVRGD9uCg.text: Any place serving hot dogs with nothing close to a Chicago hot dog is garbage. Not sure where these dogs came from, but they need to be put to sleep. Garbage!! Never again.

_v103ca76FxMqnkMB32Nug.text: Dirt Dog is a great option for a quick, affordable bite for lunch or dinner. Incredibly high quality bacon wrapped hot dogs and so much more!   They have a wide selection of over the top dogs; don't skip the lobster roll bun- it's delicious and helps to keeps all the toppings contained. The Elote Dog is my personal favorite, I have ordered it both times I have been there following a hosted event.   They have the usual suspects for sides, some also taken to the next level with toppings. But for a hot dog joint, the most notable thing on the menu is their vegan taco.. yes, you read that right- VEGAN TACO! They offer a few varieties of street tacos but the soyrizo is the best in my opinion, even for meat eaters.   They also offer a decent selection of beers, fried Oreo desserts, and a True to their LA roots atmosphere, complete with Tupac music and murals. They also have a fun map mural that serves as an interactive guestbook, allowing guests to pin where they live in the greater Las Vegas area.

zxVOK3BuVsEma7_KC_983w.text: This place is awesome, very casual and laid back. The staff is super helpful when choosing what to order. They are all knowledgeable about the food and always as if this is our first time dining. Love that each hot dog is bacon wrapped! The street corn is amazing! My favorite thing. They also have plenty of craft beers and can help you pair the best beer with your dog! The music is great and the vibe is trendy.

KBmvHA2Iaq73yLL7jJeQRw.text: I am by no means a hotdog fan but I could not resist the curiosity of the very creative colorful dogs. I live in north vegas and drove 30 minutes. My husband and I had the elote dog and my kids had the patty melt and garlic fries and the food was the most delicious hotdog I have ever had in my life. There service is amazing and fast! It gets busy quickly and I see why! I hope you guys open another location. The food money and time was totally worth it! Also I noticed a lot of people did not like the 90s rap but if you don't like it don't eat there! It is clearly a CA owned business! Im from Cali! We love love love Tupac! The owner is did good with this because dirt dog created its own lane in the food industry! I have never seen or been to any restaurant like it!  Im sure there will be copycats bc it really is that good and its very unique total one of a kind!

rpnShZ2kdjF8fKHmifxtgw.text: Today was my first time visiting Dirt Dog.  I had seen the advertisements on IG.  When i walked into the Rainbow LV location, first thing that caught my eye was the artwork and layout--- im an artist on the side myself and I can appreciate the art and layout.  The music gave me the feel of being in the SoCal area--- but we are here to talk about the food.  I moved to Vegas a year ago for my job and i'm enjoying myself (NorCal born and raised).  I've hit 28 out of 50 states in my travels and have tried great tastin dogs all over the US.  I went with the Elote Dog and right at my first bite, i was hooked.  The Dog isn t heavy or too overwhelmed with fixins...its just the right amount and the recipe and flavor combos are simply amazing.  I love corn kernels and the other fixins, sauces and spices were simply addicting!  I didnt want the experience of eating this dog to end!  Lol---I will tell all my coworkers and friends of this spot.  Keep up the great work people--- good stuff!!

0Vm1kiD5M8Vt2VyXluiddw.text: The food and decor is cute but it is very misleading to advertise and promote as a vegan hot dog place without even having vegan buns. Why go out of the way to have vegan and vegetarian options and then half ass it with no buns available. Super disappointing. Won't be back until they have True vegan food.

-JU0uqnz5cFy6IFy7nIhig.text: What a twist on hot dogs! Dirt Dog has a variety of generously-topped hot dogs and sides, displayed on a menu with pictures and descriptions right when you walk in. The cashier was very helpful in clarifying any questions we had about the items and in giving recommendations. I ended up going with the Elote Dog, my friend got the Flaming Dog, and we shared Al Pastor Fries. The Elote Dog was so good!! It was flavorful but not too salty, and squeezing some lime over it added a nice touch. The Flaming Dog was good as well (although I only had a bite since I'm not great with spicy). I really liked the Al Pastor fries. The fries were cooked nice and crispy, the meat was delicious, and the addition of pineapple was refreshing. While it was pretty filling, I didn't feel super heavy and weighed down afterward. I also appreciate that it didn't feel or taste overly greasy/oily. I'm definitely going to come back again to try more off the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flaming Dog, Al Pastor Fries, and Elote Dog!

ESIbGkVLb3MPm6t0d37dCQ.text: 100th REVIEW! Woohoo! (''( (^-^) )'')  Dirt Dog is damn good! Came here randomly after Facebook bombarded me with ads for the place. Do y'know which ones I'm talking about? ...You probably do. They're almost pornographic, in a food way.  But, anyway: I ordered the House Dog on a Portuguese bun with a side of Elote Fries.  Both were astounding! The hotdog was massive and packed with flavor. I sorta wish I had been a little more daring with my choice of dog though. The House Dog was tame compared some other options on the menu... But still tasty nonetheless!  Truthfully, it was the side of fries that stole the show for me. Just imagine: crispy, salted fries soaking up all the flavor from the creamy, lime-y corn. It's almost as if the two were meant to be combined!  I'll definitely be back to try some more.

She recommended the the elote fries, the elote and the house dog! Boy she was right on the money with what to order and took the time to chat with us. CoI93DQMtonxyu287N2rkg.text: I have driven by this place a hundred times but never came in because, honestly, hot dogs covered with tons of stuff sounds "too much" to me. I'm normally a plain dog eater, maayyybe a dot of mustard or kraut. So I was expecting a kick to the face of intense flavors. I was pleasantly surprised (shocked, even) that the dogs are balanced and not overpowering. They're delicious!! The Elote Dog is EVERYTHING. Also the best jamaica drink I've tried. And do yourself a favor and get some deep fried oreos with horchata whipped cream.   While I love the 2pac and old school tunes they play, I do wish they were the edited versions since I bring my kids here.  Tip: Allow yourself ample time when coming here. They prepare each item fresh and it's a smaller mom-n-pop-type shop, so they have a smaller staff. Don't expect to be in and out like you would getting a dog at sam's club.

CfabylfxGmX7_kMr2DkOkw.text: Food was unique,well prepared and quick to come out,staff was diligent and welcoming. The atmosphere great and the decorations added to the experience. Wish there was one closer to Aliante.

mMlGbHoX_0tdq6VqC66icQ.text: "Six-deuce every time, I never had the Heinz.  Fifty-seven can't ketchup to mines."  Jay-Z, Maybach Music 2 (Lost Verse)  L.A. loved and Vegas presented, Dirt Dog has spread its wings from The City of Angels and crash-landed in Sin City.  So hot!  We had just arrived in Vegas, buzzed and hungry, well past noon.  Southwest Airlines had a retiring pilot who ended up buying drinks for all the passengers on board in celebration of his retirement.  I guess when the pilot is buying, the flight attendants gets liberal with the booze because I needed food in me like 30-minutes ago.  After flipping through some bookmarks, Dirt Dog was chosen.  You know it hit the spot because we got dirty... so sooo dirty!  We got the Elote Dog on Texas toast [$7.25 + $0.50 for the lobster roll], a Dirty Chili Dog on Portuguese bun [$7.25], and one order of the Filthy Fries [$5.50].  That Texas toast was so buttery and crispy, it was hard trying not to moan with every bite.  If you love Mexican street corn, elote is for you.  The Dirty Chili Dog was a sodium bomb.  The Portuguese bun is slightly sweet so it helped off-set the saltiness a little bit.  Of the two dogs, I'd choose the Elote Dog over and over again.  As for the fries, they were amazing.  The Filthy Fries were topped with guacamole, chipotle aioli, cheddar, and cotija cheese.  I can imagine sitting back on a velvet couch with Chrissy Teigen in nothing but matching silk robes, eating these fries, while John Legend writes ballads on his piano about how awesome it is that I stole his wife.  He can keep Luna though.  She's cute but I ain't nobody's step-mom, okay?  So a place with 90's hip hop? Uh, yes please!  The staff is charismatic and friendly, the atmosphere is fun, and the food is great.    TL;DR  I believe Knockin' Boots said it best in, "The Original Hip-Hop:"  "Ooh boy I love you so. Never ever ever gonna let you go, once I get my hands on you!"

4n7jVh6kIAih6qOe2Zyikw.text: This place is great. They have creative dogs, fries, and deserts. The hot dog alone was amazing. There was a fresh snap when I bit into it and had huge flavor.  I got the ranchero dog and it came with beans tortilla chips, a red sauce and a fried egg. It was definitely messy but in a very good way. The red sauce had a little kick to it that really balanced everything out. My one complaint is that I really couldn't taste the beans. I think if I could have it would have been the perfect hot dog.  My brother and I went in there on a Friday a 2 pm and the place was packed. I was prepared to wait at least 20 min for my food, but it only took 5 to 10 min.  If your a hot dog lover you must try this place out!

lAt6-WiwjxiDuiR1RZFSDA.text: This place is always packed to the max and the lines are long. The food is hit and miss. Sometimes it's good and sometimes the hot dogs taste like they have been cooked over and over again. It's also a pricey place.

N9__bX_lAYrraMfsPA-VdQ.text: We came in on a Tuesday night around 9pm. We hadn't made our way to a Dirt Dog because I live way across town in Centennial Hills. We happened to be in the area and when someone suggested Dirt Dog for dinner, I immediately said yes! The menu is fun and attractive to the eye. We were torn between all the options. I personally ended up going for the Elote Dog on the butter toast. Having had authentic Mexican elotes many times in the past, I really had an expectation. Sadly, I was disappointed. I honestly didn't taste any of the "corn" flavor whatsoever. The hotdog overpowered all the toppings. That hotdog would've been good with regular hot dog toppings. I didn't try any of the other dogs at the table, so can't really say much there. I did have the horchata ice cream which was realllly good and actually tasted like horchata. Customer service was great, tables were clean, so no complaints there. Would I come back? Not unless I'm in the area and I am craving the horchata ice cream.

QmaXM1vh0McOAWzOQ6vHFQ.text: I've heard of Dirt Dog through social media and kept seeing the add for it. My partner and I were deciding for weeks to try out the delicious looking fries and hot dogs. Finally we decided to go one night. Walking into the place  I got an LA vibe, and was chill. The menu is posted on the wall next to the register with pictures and helpful descriptions of each item. The staff was cheerful and very helping. It could have maybe needed some more seating accommodations in the place do to the high volume. The food came out quicker than I thought. We both ended up getting the Elotes Dog and it was alright. It could have been a lot better with a signature sauce with the dog, but it was still very enjoyable. Now the fries were amazing. I was impressed by how they tasted. The chili fries were great. I would highly recommend them to all my friends. Overall I enjoyed it and felt very satisfied. Also it would be so convenient to open a location elsewhere around Vegas. I'll definitely be going to Dirt Dogs again.

J2bilZ0_5h4_QnZwiISWXA.text: Yasss ok?! First timer, when my husband was describing it, I was like sure - because I love hot dogs. But let me tell you, this place is more than just hot dogs, they are dirty style type dogs. I ended up getting the green dog in a lobster roll type bun, chimichurri sauce, guacamole, sauteed onions, and grilled red peppers. It was packed with flavor, I pretty much ate the whole thing in under 5 minutes. I wanted to savor the flavors, but man it's a hot dog with a flavor punch. I also decided to go with their salt and pepper fries, elote (Mexican corn on a cob), and deep fried Twinkie! Hello! Everything was great, not overly greasy ( and that's including the deep fried Twinkees and fries ) and hey guys who live on the Southwest side of town, here is a great place to get an elote --- you don't have to drive all the way to the Eastside. Overall very informing cashier/server, service was good, it had a nice vibe with the throwback music, and just a place I want to throw a beer back with good eats.

oLNHtjqtBUT1p5NmdKU6Kw.text: I went on a Tuesday & later that week on a Friday night. The atmosphere is dope with 90's hip-hop playin in the restaurant with radio friendly edits. The dedication to 2Pac is a nice touch as well. I did go there twice in 1 week so I must say I look to return soon to dive more into the menu!!!

6lkJr48uR7iANZVytWz8Xw.text: If you're ever looking for a wonderful and unusual twist on a hotdog, then I have found the place for you! Dirt dog has been a local favorite in LA for years and has been coined "The Official Hotdog of Los Angeles." Well guess what? It has finally come to Las Vegas! If you don't know what a Dirt dog is, here is a quick explanation. It is a 100% premium all beef weiner that is wrapped in a center cut slice of bacon, then served on your choice of bun and topped off with either the menu selection of toppings, or they allow you to create your own by mixing and matching for your own unique experience. This is Hands down the best Street dog I have ever tasted. The hotdog is never greasy and always tastey and served on a toasted, warm bun. Then they give you the perfect amount of topping to dog ratio and serve it to you al la carte or with a side of fries and drink if you choose. They are also open late for those of you who have a late night craving and they have a location on The Strip inside of Ballys. Seriously, this hotdog will curb any craving and your only regret is that you didn't buy 2

7u0_bSW7Ll_xHkEZYSe9oA.text: I like this place a lot.   Its close to home, they play 90s hip hop and RnB, and it makes me feel like Im back in Cali. Not to mention the food is pretty good. The only problem for me is because Im such a picky eater its hard to order anything without asking them to leave one or more items off. For instance the first time I came I got the patty melt dog but the chipotle sauce was way too spicy for me. I'll have to ask for nada next time. Then I got the chili cheese fries.  Very good but I have to ask for no cilantro and probably no onion next time as well, as it became a bit overwhelming.    What I love with no issues here is the watermelon agua fresca. Perfect balance of sweet and fresh.  The kids meals are huge. My girls especially love the oreos included. I'm looking forward to trying some deep fried treats when I feel like being a heifer. I also just learned about an horchata ice cream or drink that I would love to try as well.   Overall,  i will definitely be a regular. Thanks for the tasty food and cool vibe inside.

foIEm5d87Mp0kpPiq8o7Cg.text: You want a hot dog. A good hot dog cooked with care. With toppings you wouldn't normally add if you were to boil one at home. Enter: Dirt Dog!  A funky-looking place with hints of West Coast influence in its decor. Pretty straight forward menu, but an overwhelming menu on your first try because you want to try it all! Hot dogs are cooked to perfection! Love that the bun isn't a "bun" in the traditional sense, giving you a different experience both in taste and texture. The toppings go from end to end, so you get a great hot dog-to-toppings ratio in each bite. The French fries, those "basic" because it was just sea salt and black pepper, were fresh, piping hot, and fried just right to give you that crunch!  Definitely will be back!

6zuo6oainoSi4pYC3_Tk9w.text: OUTSIDE: finding this place is no problem. parking lot is kind of small but it was not busy.   INSIDE: whoa, the place is really hip. LA songs playing, TVs are on. the place is really clean. there are tables, booths, high chairs and tables to be seated. I like their drawing/arts on the wall. nice ambience.   CASHIER & SERVICES: friendly, helpful, nice. thanks for the recommendations and thank you for going around to check if we needed anything.   FOOD: pastrami dog & green dog is the bomb! got the carne asada fries--very crunchy crispy fries with every bite! thumbs up!  very juicy hot dogs with the sweet buns.  if you are craving for some hot dogs and are not afraid to get down and dirty with your foods, this is your place. will definitely be back if around the area. thank you delicious brunch.  PS. the watermelon juice is refreshing.

3--PKKSKhQQCboaqQlx56w.text: When the line is our the door you know you are in for something super tasty! There is a few options for hotdogs but nothing typical or basic. Let's say there is a Mutt Dog, a Pastrami Dog, Patty Melt Dog to name a few. They offer many Elote Corn options including original style with Lime Mayo child powder, and cotija cheese with bacon bits (on Cobb or in a Cup). Also fries but not basic fries we are talking Carne Asada Fries to name one and Dirty Fries to name another. Originally out of LA this is the second location. It definitely has an LA vibe with decor and music and our server Melyssa was awesome, sweet and very entertaining! She was a grest addition to amazing dirt  dogs! Definitely saved the best for last if Argentina and LA got together and had a little one it would result in the amazing Chimichuri Dog (aka green dog).....thank you Dirt Dog Vegas!!

dNpMqmB2cxTo6YArJk-SIg.text: I wanted to love this place but I just can't. We walked in to a bunch of people gathered around the menus posted on the wall. They told us to go ahead around them since it was their first time and they weren't ready yet. We told them that it was ours as well and stood behind them. Meanwhile, there are 3 employees behind the counter talking to each other. No one bothered to ask us if we needed help. As we were placing our order, a couple came in reeking of marijuana. This is obviously not the establishments fault and I'm not rating low because of this. I suppose it's unavoidable as the food that Dirt Dog serves qualifies as "munchies" material. Anyway, this caused my husband to rush the order and urge me to find a table and get away from the stench.   I got a chance to look around, decor is minimum with posters of rappers. There was a wall of hot sauce, loved that. We ended up choosing a table that was isolated so that we wouldn't end up near the couple that was high, I'm extremely sensitive to the smell and didn't think it would go well if I was to throw up mid meal.   Our order came quick enough and it looked just as appetizing as the pictures on the menu, which is rare so that was a nice surprise. We ordered an elote dog on a lobster roll, al pastor fries, and the horchata ice cream.   Elote dog- pretty good, we liked this better than the al pastor fries. The elote was decent, definitely not real Mexican quality but good enough. My husband, who had Dirt Dog before, said the lobster roll made a big difference.   Al Pastor fries- wayyyyyy too salty, fries were cooked well but fries are hard to mess up.  Horchata ice cream- not enough horchata flavor, it was more vanilla with a very slight taste of cinnamon. I've made horchata ice cream that tastes better. It was topped off with Rice Krispies and stale peanuts. The churro that was served with it had a good enough flavor but it was too dense.   Overall, the meal fell a little flat. If you're planning on ordering fries and a hot dog, I definitely recommend splitting it with someone as the servings are quite generous. We may return to try it out again and maybe order some different things but we won't be in a rush to do so.

l_uwfCMWbnVds6GDHd03bQ.text: Overhyped place, the house dogs were good on their own but I highly recommend you enjoy them with some cold ones next door at the Sin City brewery, they often hand out buy one beer get one free cards and they let us sit and eat at their bar, it was really awesome.

UO0M_UJHajz67cOsu8MzZg.text: Came here with some friends to try out Dirt Dog, at least for me.  I ordered the House Dog and shared the Dirty Fries with my friends.  I gave this place a 4 star because the House Dog tasted amazing.  I sure do enjoy a very simple yet tasty hotdog. iZTr4IEzgbmtjQSI25ZDIA.text: This is my kind of place! Nice visual displays, clean, yet the ambiance is very old-school hip hop & I like it! I honestly don't agree with anyone who has to give this place a low star rating, unless they're just used to those fancy restaurants... if you want fancy? then this place isn't for you! but if you want excellent service along to go with some delicious and filling hot dogs accompanied with their awesome fries to compliment your meal, then this is the place for you! xnlfimzSNd-_B8SqcCI0hQ.text: In this review I will talk about the good, the bad, and the ugly. I was a little disappointed with Dirt Dog and it hurts me to say that. I am from East L.A. and bacon wrapped street hot dogs are famous all over L.A. So I was excited when I heard Dirt Dog was an L.A. style hot dog joint that opened in Las Vegas not too long ago.   First the good. The bacon bits and chorizo toppings on the hot dogs were an amazing combination. I ordered the Dirty Chili Dog and I never imagined that chile goes well with chorizo and bacon bits. The onions and cilantro on the hot dog were also a surprisingly good topping. I believe the toppings are the real winner here.    Now the bad. The flavor of the hot dog itself was just average and it did not leave much of an impression on  me. These are all beef Nathan's Hot Dogs? Hmmm... You get three choices of buns for your hot dogs. They are traditional, Portuguese, and lobster roll (not lobster flavor). I went with the traditional bun and I was in for unpleasant surprise. I grab the hot dog and after the first bite my hot dog sliped down through the bread and fell on my plate (see the pic).  I only had bread and toppings on my hands and strugggled to put the hot dog back in the buns. I wonder if the other hot dog buns hold the hot dog better. I also ordered the Dirty Chile Fries and found the fries dry and salty. This was a serious sodium overdose lol. I could not finish eating my food...what a bummer.   And finally the ugly. After I placed my order I walked around the dining area to get a table to sit at. I sat down and to my shock my table was dirty. I had to grab a few napkins to clean the top because it was full of crumbs. Yes I could have sat at another table but noticed the other tables had some debris on them as well. And finally the price of the food in my opinion was expensive. Almost 15 bucks for a hot dog, chile fries, and a soda...no bueno.   So there you have my honest review. I can not give this place one star because it has potential to really be a great place. If Dirt Dog had specials on specific days or 2 for 1 hot dogs this would get a higher rating from me. But for now it is what it is.

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My hot dog took a slide out of the buns!

oajJVoeExYorrOR3xqeiww.text: They always give excellent customer service & great food. The atmosphere is even pretty cool inside. I highly recommend it.

XrhIoi796YM6VQsf7Wzyqw.text: Really really good hot dogs with a quality flavor, and grill marks and a nice snap. I had the classic hot dog and all the condiments blended together wonderfully. The lobster roll style bun was also great. The dirty fries were okay, a bit too salty, but and a lot of them were overcooked and hard. The hot dog was good enough to keep this score at 5 stars, but improving the quality of the fries would be much appreciated. Overall I recommend, probably the best hot dogs in Vegas.

8wtBfPh0B_rJTnJwTZUiXg.text: I really enjoyed my visit here at Dirt Dog! There was a big line when I got there and while waiting in line a worker was offering one free beer  ( why not). I got a veggie dog / green dog and was delicious! As well the dirty esquite and deep fried Oreos!

0F2GQsCNJlbjC5nPm9jf_A.text: I have been to this location one time before.  It was  yelp Elite gathering and we had the chance to taste bite size hot dogs and elote.  I was going to a show at the South Point Hotel that evening so I took a bit of a detour to get there.  There's a sign for the restaurant facing Rainbow Boulevard but the entrance is on the other side of the building.  There is plenty of parking in this strip mall.  Enter from the parking lot.  You first come to a rope line for when it's busy.  There's a menu board on the wall to your right.  When you get to the register, place your order.  I ordered a red dog--a hot dog with spicy tomato chili sauce and chipotle aioli.  It also comes topped with bacon bits.  For my dirty side, I got garlic fries--tossed with house made garlic oil, garlic seasoning, and garlic bits. (It's for the garlic lover.  You'll be tasting garlic for a few hours.)  I also got an iced tea.    The person at the register will ask about dining in or to go.  If you're dining in, they'll give you a plastic number tag to place where you sit.  While they're doing their thing, go to the beverage area and get your drink.  That's also where you'll get plastic cutlery, napkins, and salt/pepper, etc.  I was just seated from getting my drink when a worker brought my dirt dog.  The red dog is spicy.  The dogs are moist and the toppings will get on your fingers so make sure you get enough napkins.  The fries were outstanding.  Crisp with lots of garlic.    I'll have to make this detour more times.  It's a good stop.

Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic fries.
Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A red dog.

leMZB4SAvkxG8tfRNWXmvQ.text: Great place definitely be back again the atmosphere has a cool vibe. The staff are very helpful for us first timers.

Cc22RY2YgoG0hwGHkJRExw.text: It's been a while so same drill as always: Customer Service, Ambiance, and - most importantly - FOOD!  Customer Service: Last time, I have to say I didn't have a good grasp of the customer service in this place. We ordered at the counter and it was brought to us the end but this time was different. When we ordered I had ordered a bottled coke to go with my meal but I was taking it home after. When the cashier realized this she offered to just put it in the fridge and I could grab it when I left so that it was cold. There were servers and both were fairly attentive. I wish they had name tags so I could thank them by name but both were great. The checked up on us and made sure we were good.   Ambiance: Nothing's changed about the way I feel about the place. It has bits and pieces of LA atmosphere and a very cool mural in the back of the restaurant. The one thing that I absolutely love though would be the huge map of vegas. Sadly it doesn't show my part of town but I love the concept of placing your mark at a place you've visited.   Food: I ordered a patty melt dog and an order of elotes fries. I loved the patty melt dog it was super messy but overall delicious. The elotes fries left something to be desired. I love the idea but there was nothing really sticking the corn and the cheese to the fries I was essentially eating fries and using a spoon to eat the corn and cheese. I wish there was something to have the corn and cheese stick to the fries. It might be a heck of a lot more messy but easier to eat everything together overall.  All in all, I will come back here in the future. I love the place as a whole and want to try everything on their menu gradually.

rHjfrp_CT7o_2rzeJIT10Q.text: Amazing food. Service was a bit lacking. Too many people working but not communicating well? They were polite, but we had to ask a few times for missing items from our order. The food was great though and we'll be back.  Update: We have visited again, everyone was great and food was just as good as the first time!

ZHN9OMqM-YyIL719vvWy5g.text: I've passed this place while at work and finally made it in. I ordered the patty melt dog and an 805 beer. Total came to around $14. When you walk in, the menu is up on the wall. It is a little overwhelming but the cashier was very helpful. I'd recommend going before rush hour or after for your first time because it does get busy and you don't want to hold up the line with questions.   They have a fairly small menu but it all looks good. They even have a veggie dog for those of you that don't eat meat.   Received my food really quickly! It was hot and delicious and went wonderfully with the beer. I'd go back to try other dogs and maybe even some of the desserts.

I took them off and the dog was great! Got the semi sweet bun, I'd recommend the Texas toast like my boyfriend got. If this place was closer, I'd definitely come more frequently! Definitely right for the price

rTdYTxFV8t2K_kZNlKx77w.text: My hubby had heard about this place & wanted to check it out. First, we were greeted immediately. The guy taking our order was awesome! Informed us what DD about, good things to try, etc. service is great here!  We decided to try the elote dog & carne asada fries. I thought the dog was very flavorful! Quality beef dog with great seasonings, creamy sauce. A bit messy to eat but good! The carne aside fries were pretty good. The fries themselves were the seasoned kind that I love! They were cooked perfectly. More carne asada & sauce would have made them even better.

ZG4n7amqcrSuCTgVP5lJmQ.text: Wow. That's all I can say about this place. I mean.. omg. It was soo good. We tried the dog with hot cheetos crumbled all over it (don't remember the name), with a classic elote, garlic fries, and fried oreos with the dip they gave us for them... damn. So good. So many options to choose from with all menu items, there's likely to be something for everyone. Everything is unique, EVERYTHING is delicious.  Aside from good food, they had good service, the place was well kept, and the food was ready quickly. Overall, an "A+" experience. I wouldn't change anything about it. Can't wait to go back!

3qDMslmCS32s1J1lhY9Gvg.text: This hot dog joint is SoOooOoo DIRTY. In a good way!  Dirt Dog brings Its big fat fun Los Angeles street food menu to Southwest Las Vegas. Excellent! This side of town needed a shakeup from the big box food joints we've been seeing pop up over the years.   Almost everything on the Dirt Dog menu is piled with more stuff than you can shake a corn cob skewer at! The hot dogs are loaded, the corn on the cob is loaded, the fries were super crispy, and yep - LOADED WITH DIRTY GOODNESS  Our table ordered  Dirty Corn Garlic Fries Street Tacos (Chicken) The House Dog Dirty Chili Dog   The hot dog is sausage sized so the hot dog itself is gigantic. Depending on what type of dog you get, there is a heaping pile of stuff slapped on top. Prepared to get sloppy!  Everything was super tasty, the staff was really friendly and atmosphere was fun. It was packed on Sunday at 4:30.   Prepare for an 80's / 90's hip hop/rap vibe. I was really happy when Biz Markie hit the speakers "OH BABY YOU - GOT WHEN I NEEEEED -YOU SAY SHES JUST A FRIEND...."  The only problem with Dirt Dog is the location. It's located behind another store front off of Rainbow.  The parking is a little rough too. Lots of car jockeying going on.   Another small issue with our visit was that Dirt Dog's air conditioner was broken. You would think that alone would turn my fat ass away from the place, but I honestly didn't notice until the end of the meal when I was sweatin' n' eatin'!  I give Dirt Dog 3 stars because, let's face It, it's a street food joint with seats. If I was only rating hot dog joints, I would give Dirt Dog a solid 4.5 stars. I can't compare this place with a Chef Marc's.  I recommend everyone check out Dirt Dog. You'll have fun and eat some really flavorful things. Make sure you think of me if/when Biz Markie comes on the speakers.   :)

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gM7Y2cdj6jhKugcUPICs4w.text: Been meaning to stop in here for a while and I'm kicking myself for waiting for so long. Best dogs in the city. Everything on the menu is exceptional. Couldn't reccomend the flaming corn enough. The atmosphere is great and Josh is always walking around making sure everyone has what they need.  You gotta check this place out.

lNnCR8B_XTPEtedfCGOegg.text: Awesome place for some amazing gourmet hot dogs. Atmosphere is very relaxed with usually old school hip hop. They have a decent selection of draft beers. We got an order of the house dog, an order of the mutt dog (half green half red), and an order of elote fries. Nothing but great things to say, the dogs are supreme quality, the bread (we only get the lobster roll) amazing, and the toppings just on point. All the food was fresh and delicious , beer was cold. Overall amazing experience.

UgvFwePzK_mEWpG7Za68WQ.text: I have visited this place a few times when they first opened, but had not visited in over 6 months. Their food is unique and takes you out of the same ol hot dog type food. They are creative with their food and you could eat there often and not burn out because of all the choices they offer.   We have tried a few of their hot dogs, our favorites being the patty melt, mutt dog and the dirt chili dog. Besides the hot dogs their dirty esquite, garlic fries and churro's are also favs.   They have a friendly staff, and when ordering they are always patient no matter how long the line is. When we visited today, they were packed with a steady flow of people lined up out the door and the service was still top notch, they seemed to thrive in the high paced environment.  With the amount of business they get, they may need to invest in more space, as there were no tables available to eat so you had to keep an eye out to rush to a table once it opened.

x8y7T-9xfhdlVQzNMO-Bxw.text: This place is AMAZING and the very definition of FOOD PORN. If you feel like taking foody porn pics on your phone for Instagram, this is a good spot to go for photos AND for great food.  This place primarily focuses on hot dogs so if you're a hot dog fan like me, you've come to the right place my friend. They have a variety of different dogs you can choose from. My personal favorite is the Red Dog but you really can't go wrong with any of them.  While their hot dogs are widely celebrated, their tacos are underrated and also very tasty. I always order one hot dog and taco because ordering just one doesn't quite fill me up. I admit the food takes a while to come out but once it does your patience will be rewarded!  Solid choice for lunch, you should check it out!

The first thing that hits you is cumin and just has a stench to it. Definitely something you can't eat if you go back to office cause you're going to have an odor  Disappointed completely by the taste- and how they say LA street food. L6cm0hglrUfMHuivZxZS8Q.text: My siblings are in town and wanted to try this place. It's only 3 mins from my place.  It's a little hard to spot. Literally in the same building as Pho Annie in the left corner. When you first walk in, it's a little crammed from the front the entrance and where you order. The art work is nice and matches the music they play.   Once you order, you find a seat and they bring you your food. A lady also came by to give us utensils and napkins. They had quite a few people there but our food came out within 10 mins.   We ordered The House Dog, Dirty Chili, and Patty Melt. We each tried each other's dogs and 2 out of 3 of us liked the House Dog better but they were all very good. So good, they came back here two more times to try something different lol.   I am not someone who really enjoys hot dogs but this was actually pretty good.

2f_gMl15hSzX2Ncb15mCOA.text: Great food! I got the patty melt dog because I'd been seeing the taunting ads for it on Instagram for months before getting a chance to visit and it did not disappoint! The chipotle sauce on it was perfection. Also, we had an issue at our table and staff went above and beyond to resolve it and compensate us, which was greatly appreciated!

ff8pibDZq4Z0inEDrldiLA.text: I was surprised this place was empty when we came around dinner time on a Sunday. The place was clean and quiet, so it was a nice place to take two families with four kids. They enjoyed eating here and there were plenty of booths, so it was easier to take care of the little ones.   They offer five variations of dogs with three choices of buns and six sides. Although I wish they had more options, I was satisfied with my red dog (even though I'm not a big fan of hot dogs). I also had garlic fries and the elote in a cup - so good and easy to eat!!! They do offer veggie dogs as well, so that's helpful for anyone that's trying to decide with vegetarian friends where to go for lunch without having to settle for "healthy food."  Outside, there is not much parking, but the other businesses don't have much traffic either.

XnQLZoZnoO-vIzdcWCN_0A.text: Was a great overall experience, staff was incredibly nice and helpful! The food was okay, if there was one closer to my house I may eat there again, but since I live so far away I won't make the trek. Got the red dog which was supposed to be spicy, but it was pretty mild to no flavor at all really and was overloaded with onions. 157A-BcM5QIKxbQ0ujVQCA.text: Ok so the first thing I noticed the menu item prices were higher than the prices that are posted here on Yelp. You might want to change that.... Other than that, this place is pretty dang amazing. I just hope this place doesn't change and head south like every other place I fall in love with!!! The staff is super happy, full of energy, polite and hard working! You can see the cooks busting their butts to get your food out fast! And it really does come out fast! The front of house staff is always moving and getting the tables cleans and taking care of customers.  The music! Omg, if you like old school REAL rap like Tupac and Eminem then you'll love this place. My bestie and I were dancing and singing while eating our amazing eats!  Good times.  We had the original dirt dogs, the carne Asada fries, the garlic fries and the dirty esquite! It was heaven!!!! We finished everything but the fries(so heavy but yummy). But we took them to go! Throwing them babies in my over later for a snack!  Every single thing we are was ahhhhhhmazing!!!!! Topped off our meal with super delish deep fried Oreos! Omnomnom!!!! I can't believe I've never seen this place! I'm so in love.... can't wait to try other items on my next visit! And I'm pretty sure that will be real soon!! Keep up the great work dogs!!!!

6VSFHoZhqduwgWX-pbQBHA.text: Seriously they need to bring this place to Northern California ASAP!  While visiting here in Vegas, my girlfriend and I decided to stop by. ILwZ623sQOAGhnsVwWxpwQ.text: Over priced hot dogs that anyone can make at home. Ordered the green dog, house dog, garlic fries, and the fried Twinkie. Out of everything the only thing I would go back for is the fried Twinkie. The house dog has nothing special and the green dog is like a taco hot dog. The buns are very greasy and so are the fries. Overall I thought there would be more flavor to everything. The Twinkie however is delicious!
