Y2CylgrmH_55X51TgyyRjA.text: Walked in, looke at the menu on the wall for a good minute, waited a bit more, looked around an empty place except for a cook in the kitchen.  Grabbed a seat, heard a woman speaking to the cook, said something about people walking in. We sat for another minute, got up and walked out.  The staff just blankly stared at us through the window in the kitchen as we walked out the door. No hello, no good bye. Are they out of busines? Too busy to help the only clients in the place? Don't know and wont bother to find out.

zojKZ5e7e-H3bPUOjQEg1w.text: They created a unique way to present a hot dog and it works. We tried the house dog, elote dog and the chili dog on Texas toast bread with sea salt and pepper fries. SO GOOD! Friendly service. Food was brought out in a timely manner. Can't wait to go back and try the other hot dog creations they got. Only thing I wish they had an outside eating area.

k2Dl4aEFGqrlYz4TUhPRFQ.text: The food here was delicious!  You can get hot dogs w/all kinds of different condiments on them. I love the buns too, they aren't your typical white bread bun, the bread they use is like a fresh baked thin bagel wrapped around the hot dog, unbelievable!  They have a good variety of fries too. It's too bad hot dogs aren't the healthiest meal cuz I could eat there every day if it were.

x-UYbdBSRq2_Cx_dJnAEWQ.text: I think this is first 5 stars i have given. When i entered i was so skeptical it was so busy and you havr to wait in line to order. I dodnt have a nice table and it was self seating. I was tired hungry and drove from north laa vegas toneat there. However a booth opened up and everything changed our food was delivered and for a hot dog and fried i was in heaven. I had a red dog found out all doga are bacon wrapped! I love the bacon. Carni asada fries regular fried 2 tacos and a dr. Pepper. All the food was so fresh. The wait staff was awesome checking in several times making sure we were happy and our needs met. I honestly dont think i gave a 5 star review and im shocked itnwas so much more than a hot dog stand. Good job to all at dirt dogs and i suspect you will see me again.

P5MAiZR7ZRq5aHWzZeN4wQ.text: Amazing food, beer, & service!  Was especially blown away with the fried Oreos:)  Can't ask for anything more!

Phip2sw0aSfpoNXn2vYKOQ.text: Worth the drive off the strip. Easily one of the best hotdogs my wife and I have ever had. Must try it on the lobster roll.

U0wgfIo9KpZLYC4IRpZF7Q.text: So delicious!!! My favorite is the brown dog. They even have veggie dogs! I love it here. I can't wait to be back.

aBO6naZjU6U2Q7oBPGj4GA.text: Sooooo good!!! we had the red dog and the green dog!! the red dog was better, lots of flavor! We also had the fries, corn, ice cream and amazing churros!! I can't remember the names. but very delicious!! will return!!! :) clean and friendly service!

ve9d6WK82VpCAm_HxqGDVw.text: Very disappointed with this establishment. Went to the location in Vegas near Bally's. Was so excited to eat here but there menu in store did not reflect the same menu they have online. Wanted to order the veggie dog which is on their site and when they said they don't have it they proceeded to ask me if I wanted a beef one instead. I'm pretty sure if your asking for a veggie dog, you most likely don't eat beef!

gpCW_g5ve9lZKOMNjunAGg.text: Omg!!! This place rocked my life!! I can't believe there's one back home in LA and I'm trying it for the first time in Vegas! We had the Green Dog, The Dirty Chili Dog, and a plain bacon wrapped hot dog (for my 6 year old) The Filthy Fries, two Dirty Corns and one Dirty Esquite. All that and not one complaint!! The flavors were amazing. Not only was the food outstanding the service was also impeccable. The lady at the register (who happens to be one of the owners) was incredibly helpful and explained all the items, as well as suggesting their popular items. This place was so good that if they didn't have one in LA I'd be super bummed! But knowing I can have this whenever I want once I'm back in LA makes me do a little happy food dance!!

C7lP5SXhT7NPgIOp8PNcHQ.text: The hot dogs were really good but I would like to see a bigger menu. It was really good to try and I'll probably go back! It was also very clean which is always a plus.

SgMoZ9lphgyfWOAPnxLSQw.text: A pretty decent place! Been there twice. First time by myself, second time brought a friend. The food definitely tastes good, but the portions are small, if you get just one hot dog, you'll leave hungry. A couple things I have to mention about this place that made it into 4 star instead of 5.  First of all, there is no menu at the table, the setup is more like McDonald's. But the problem is that people are very indecisive. It makes the wait extremely long, for example, last night, I had to wait about 15 minutes for just 2 people in front of me to order.. They were standing there, looking at the menu and couldn't decide what they wanted. This could be easily solved if there were either more cashiers (instead of just one), or even better, let people sit at a table and give them a menu so they can sit there as long as they want until they decide. This way others won't have to wait so long. Second thing is the restroom. The place can get pretty busy, the place serves beer and plays music. This means that people might want to stick around a little longer, but the restroom is only for one person at a time. This can get very uncomfortable. You have to wait even if you just want to go wash your hands. Otherwise it's a very nice place, cozy set up. Food doesn't take too long to prepare. I recommend

q7jzPqtnZTaQoNpg47CcTg.text: Yeah! This was  first time visit for myself and my lunch group. The food was delicious. I had the chili dirty dog and the dirty corn. Yum! Others tried the street tacos, the house dog and the several different dog names ( I can't remember them all) and the dirty fries. So many choices! We were too stuffed to try the dessert but maybe next time.The place was really crowded, lines out the door for the whole 2 hours we were there. They have a real small area to wait in line so even 10 people will fill it up. Had people cleaning tables constantly. The service was great. A waitress came and gave us silverware, water and extra napkins after I secured a few tables for our group even though they had not arrived yet! I would go again. I love the lobster rolls instead of hot dog buns. Just ups the taste a little. Lots of spice but not too much on most items. Great place and I understand they are opening 3 more spots. Must see where they will be. Only negative for me was the LOUD LOUD music. Music was rap but could have toned the volumn down a bit.

z4fB6mf_Dd08PxC4R1e1jQ.text: So good I want to eat myself sick trying all the bomb ass f*#^ dirty delicious food!! And they have a tiny little bar and nice dining area highly recommend!! I'm coming back tomorrow to smash on all the stuff I didn't try!

C4QYIQ6BmDs2kygKkCz2DA.text: Went to the Rainbow location first time to eat here.  Saturday 4th of March for husbands birthday.  We tried chili, corn and patty dog all 3 where great.  We also got seasoned garlic fry's they where excellent.  Place was clean and friendly.  Liked it so much we came back on Monday 6th March.  We only got the Corn and green dogs with garlic fry's.  I will say still clean and friendly BUT food not even the same.  The dirty corn tasted good but not as good as Sat.  I came back specifically for the garlic fry's.  They where not seasoned, under cooked and raw garlic in a pile on top.  Now that said if that is how they normally are served then my bad.  The person who was cooking on Saturday around 3-4 ish  really knows how to cook and make people come back for more.  Consistency is the key and there was none in the food department.

B1JXEBNnqv0MvO8pbJfhVg.text: Seriously, I'm never disappointed when I come here! Cameron is seriously the BEST!! I absolutely love his energy every time I go in there he really just makes the experience that much more incredible!!! And well, the food is just as GREAT!!!! Love this place

UtyqoiiybJjwsYKU1qW9Bg.text: Finally tried this place! All the great pictures on Instagram and reviews make it it look so tasty! Portions are smaller than pictured. We tried the Dirty Fries and they could of used more chili and cheese and they were a bit on the salty side but, taste great! The hot dogs are delicious. I also ordered the Corn Mesquite and was a bit unsatisfied, the cup was literally filled half way, flavor was great though.....but for the price they could have filled the cup (just like pictured on the menu and what you see on IG). Place itself is nice, clean and spacious. Prices could be either lower or portions could be a bit more fuller/bigger.   All aside, great place and great flavors!

faWexUG4p9s-fx1cbBpF5A.text: Only ate here once, but will definitely be coming back. The hot dogs are delicious, fries come up a bit short compared to their dogs. But those arent the main attraction here. Beer selection is decent with great tasting beers on tap. Oh, and there's a secret menu

LpRX66NYUWo212LFoBkQkQ.text: My family loved the food. The elotes were bomb! I'm not a hot dog person but they really changed my mind today lol. Most definitely gonna be a regular!

jqLUhHIq-vaFWxv1YQdR-g.text: This place has absolutely delicious food. The hot dogs are cheesy and amazing. The corn is great! I love that you can choose on or off the cob. :D the only downside is if it's busy, the line gets cramped at the door and it's difficult to get a seat or table. It's worth going for the food. You can get it to go I'd you want. I would recommend you go even if just once.

mQ0mpC2U4wYjajRMUuhjQQ.text: Absolute worst place I have been. Ordered the Patty melt dog with sea salt and pepper fries. Fries were delivered to the table with absolutely no seasoning. Then when the dogs came to the table they had raw onions. We asked for grilled. They took them back to remake them. The second time around the onions were grilled but the fries on the dog were ice cold. At that point I asked for the manager. However, she was too busy messing with the TV. We waited over 5 minutes for her to come over so we just got up and demanded a refund. Also both dogs were the exact same, yet looked completely different. Don't waste your time going here.

dBN_Sztg6OhRffv1DaYNwA.text: I had the pleasure of eating here today for lunch. I had garlic fries and the chili dog on a lobster roll. Man, it was amazing. The restaurant has great art on the walls and the music is wonderful.  The only problem is that it is a 30 minute drive from where I live. It sure would be nice to have one of these up in Centennial Hills or Aliante.

LZ8gUdjfvg7MuU3qn_ECSw.text: Good amount of selection for your main course and sides. Helpful staff when I visited. The food got to our table quick. Not to sure if there is extra seating but when me and my crew arrived, it was around noon on a weekend. It's open choice for your seats. Didn't really scope out the place to find more seats, we just grabbed seats when we had the chance. On the plus side we came in before the rush. Overall, tasty food, good people/vibes/staff. Will definitely be back!

zTqpyOyvx9m0eY3-ewbaPA.text: Good atmosphere, bland food. Anything with "chili powder" tastes like actual chili seasoning, not the spicy kick you'd be expecting. It ended up making the two vegan tacos I ordered taste like they had actual chili in them. The corn in the cup was flavorless as well, and also tasted like chili. My fiance even said it when he tried it. He got the chili dog and said it wasn't good at all: there was no flavor at all. Everything was good quality and homemade BUT NO FLAVOR OR SPICE.   Although the atmosphere was nice (they played modern music and had board games to play), you go to a restaurant to eat and the food is not worth it and outweighs anything good about Dirt Dog. I'm sad, and the pictures looked so good. What a let down.

VJxkNwW3ALmzB0aJhwWeiA.text: Stoppedbin today for some elote fries but saw they have added, not only street tacos, but Vegan ones! I am on the path to vegan and these were great! I most definetly will be back and also will let my vegan friends know! As always the flavors were on point!

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Elote Fries. My favorite.
Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan street taco (minus the bell peppers) Very flavorful and only $2!  Hell ya!

NAkBK_34WGqsmilZ_1OzLw.text: Love it. Great environment, friendly staff and good music. Card games, dominoes and Jenga to play and keep you entertained rather than everyone on their phone zombied out. Food arrived fast and was delicious and filling. I love how they have glass bottled coke ( my favorite ) always a plus in my book.

5_xo1s5mukPkV4A1r55gqQ.text: It's been a long time since I've lived in LA and I often crave the hot dogs I used to get at the swap meet. Dirt Dog hit the spot. It was kind of pricey for hot dogs but the place was clean and bright and the food tasted fresh. The only downside was that my niece's chili dog took the entire visit to be made. They ran out of chili and had to make up a whole new batch. It was a Tuesday around 6PM so it does seem a bit like poor planning to run out at that time. However, the cashier came by to apologize and they were very considerate of us. Definitely looking forward to my next visit.

fJ12XUGpvh9jBJxX8CuSgw.text: Akeelah is one of the best waitresses here at Dirt Dog. Every time we come in, she brightens our day. We had a problem with one of our meals, and she fixed it immediately. Akeelah is the definition of great service with a smile, they really should give the girl a raise!

ikNlW16Pq0R50zzYo3Pe1w.text: How can you have a vegan hot dog without a vegan bun. Clearly it's not vegan, duh. Will not be coming here.

g1WDsRUCshxDhiMvLZ4-fQ.text: I have to say it's a great place their hotdogs is awesome you have to try at their customer service is great straight to the place would you like to order you will love it I will do recommend my friends and family thank you for a great place........

9mraQmv2s9GbEY5LIBz7Zg.text: Small place but the food is really good ...my daughters  and I came here we had an amazing time mostly Mexican food but obviously  hot dogs and they're amazing there frys are really good and the customer services is on point.

ZKLLoB7FMYG-PoDi-DCZKw.text: If you like hot dogs then you will looooove this place. If you like Mexican corn then this is the only place you should come!  Not to mention all the old school hip hop playing while you're eating. I will back fo sho!

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yeah! Yeah! (In my Ice Cube voice)

Z011suVFvfNnitfuDqbFXQ.text: I just paid 13.00 dollars for a hot dog with mustard and onions, French fries and a bottle of water. I don't care how magical this hotdog is it's not worth that price. This is my first time in this business and it will certainly be my last!!!  Just finished the hotdog and fries. And yep not worth it. The roll was dry and the dog seemed over cooked. Avoid this place, save your money.

ccCukjiXWY-yHFqwm7-tTA.text: Im not a big fan of hotdogs but this was a great experience. Our group had the Brown Dog in Portugese bun, Green dog in Lobster bun, and House dog with regular bun. All awesome.  The horchata ice cream brought the house down though. That with a fried twinkie. Blows your mind!!! Mmmmmm. Can't wait to go back!

3UxQ_B5ojCkrw6ewvVMaIA.text: I'm so late it's a shame of me cause dirt dog is an awesome hotdog place courteous friendly service I loved the dirt dog and I went here when they had a grand opening for there new store then I returned multiple times after that and sometimes they send out coupons to try one for free highly recommended and of course repeat repeat repeat........

KTDFWfM5DDpXvcIVVS185A.text: Service was slow with one person working the register and serving for the whole restaurant during peak lunch time. Hotdogs were expensive and not filling for 7.25 each. Can't justify paying $25+ for lunch to get full here. Going to have to find something to eat shortly.... wtf.

fzTGUVdrpTKRknyLRN4Lbw.text: It was soo good! I had the Elote fries! YESS!!! I will definitely be going back! So clean, and really friendly staff.

crcSO5VXYZ6Br7oz_q0GzA.text: This place was awesome.. took my family here n they don't like anything they loved their hot dogs. Very happy n great customer service

L8Lb6PJmY-rzbMgvByhq4A.text: Their fries are great! And the dogs there are better, and after you finish you're meal, they have awesome deep fried Twinkies and deep fried Oreos

SV6B7k3iFFEwlr6uskHNWw.text: Awesome atmosphere. I definitely liked their fries and dogs. The corn was a bit too much for me but I had eaten a lot of food already. :)  I am glad I finally got to check them out though I'm not sure I'd go too often as it's so tempting and fattening.

e7_QTgMUXDWihKOrm40FUg.text: It was good it's fun it's a very expensive hotdog novelty thing nothing life shattering

YMhHLcKtFj5wFWutYqVPHA.text: This place was great! I was craving some Hot Dogs and had recently heard of this place. Glad I came! They had variations of hot dogs , Tacos and Street Corn. It was really good, but now I have to come back and try them all!!! They also sell beer which was a nice touch.

cazUJRoln12v1UlMOTmheA.text: I finally gave Dirt Dog a try and the hype is real. The dog I had was wrapped in bacon and topped with elote which I didn't expect to like but damn the combination of flavors tasted great. The dog was big and had nice flavor and the bun was slightly grilled in butter. I didn't care much for the al pastor tacos but the chicken tinga and asada were bomb af. The tinga was spicy and the flavors were good but the asada was the real winner for me I"ll be back to plow through many more of those. The carne adasa nachos didn't last long at our table everybody really liked them the chips tasted so good. They serve beer here but I recommend the horchata. I wish I had room for some of the fried oreos but I'll have to save room next time.

CeNBk756xRKc0ca3JYgmjg.text: This place was alright. I felt that there were too much hyped before I went with all the reviews and pictures. I had the red dog and the elote fries. The dog was a bit dry for my taste and the fries was meh. I didn't think there was anything special for this place. The best thing of the place is the toast (lobster style). You must specify for that if you wanted that instead of the regular bun. As for the price, it seems fair (about $6.75) for each regular dog. It's worth a try but I've tasted better hot dog.

KeYNh_88O4kJA2jPMXkc4A.text: My first time here and I really enjoyed it. I really like the vibe this place gives out and the hot dogs are amazing! To top it all off, they had deep fried oreos and those were to die for. I will definitely be back!

i1Q3XBcRHgHsSZMMYjti1g.text: My only qualm is with myself and why, WHY in the 6 years I lived in LA did I not eat here sooner!!! My dad and I took a little Vegas vacay and this was seriously the highlight of the trip. We happened to be off the strip and in looking for a lunch spot and this popped up. They had me at bacon hot dogs, because they're absolutely magical. Anyone who disagrees hates puppies, babies, and rainbows. I had the elote dog and the dirty fries. I almost cried tears of joy if the dessert didn't dry them instantaneously. Dad still talks about it to this day. Anytime we sit down to eat he sighs and says, "how good would a dirt dog be right now." and looks at his food so forlornly it's almost sad.  Thanks dirt dog.  I think you broke my dad. Lol.

zXUOA_9ab34XUcrxzHIrOw.text: You can't go to Vegas and not visit this place. Everything is delicious and the crew is so friendly and happy that you are there. They need more locations... Passdena, Santa Ana, Universal City.

MbpqU40zAOLdwnUIusRppA.text: So..... not what I expected !! The hot dog was very good but a very disappointing menu and selection !!! I really thought there would have been more to choose from and it was a pricey for what you get !!  The place was very clean although one of the workers walking through the dining  room had a bag in his hand and it was leaking something!!  My hot dog was very good but my wife's cheese on the dog was over cooked!!   I would expand the menu for all ......

rWSDDO9GEsEU3OQB8DRHDg.text: Ordered two Red Dogs, Dirty Fries and Seasalt and Pepper fries . Paid extra for the Lobster bun , definitely worth it  . Pretty good overall . The Dirty fries didnt have the Limon kick I was expecting tho . Wish they had more options on the menu .  Nice atmosphere and set up . Mostly heard hiphop while I was eating , then it switched to some James Brown and Frankie Lymon . I like ! Was pretty dead when we came in but the table we went to had crumbs all over it . Besides that , pretty clean .

NmMdAuIv1oxm16Hv7deeZw.text: Eh.... just ok... we were excited to go to Dirt Dog! Heard good things about it.... got there today about 1:30, line was wrapped around....Thought, Good sign! I ordered the chili dog as it came...garlic and peppers were burnt little pieces sprinkled over the burnt "homemade chili". Yuck.. Hot dog was crisp when you bit into it which I liked but I never tasted nor saw any cheese.  Hubs got the chimmichurry and avocado dog. He did not finish it... just was not good... we also had the garlic fries, which we normally love but, not these... Way too much garlic and we love garlic! Figi water ordered and on menu but was given Smart Water.... all in all...doubt we would return....

qWLaIz33M1PfMMg6FIFaUA.text: This place was very clean and loved the environment. The staff was very friendly but not much help with suggestions or anything (so make sure you know what you want). The food was ok, but in my opinion kinda pricy (social media hyped it up), I had higher expectations. Paid about $25 for just 2 hotdogs, fries and a drink.

daJo-otH-wRFnQLwjwF1qg.text: Eh. Ok dogs. Street corn was tiny. Music playing was completely inappropriate for children. I may go back to give it another try, but definitely not with my kids.

bVGvGtXytwU1S4OP2e0eKA.text: Delicious hot dogs, good prices great atmosphere.  Everybody was super friendly and attentive.  Great music and games to play, we were too busy trying all the great food.  Kids meals are a great deal, corn dogs, fries, drink and Oreos with an amazing horchata whipped cream.  One of the favorites for our group were the Filthy Fries, awesome guacamole!

E02LswP4lt3mD0wKSJtWKw.text: Cool spot. It's hip and they have good food. They have quite a few vegan and vegetarian options. You should definitely try the vegan tacos! And another great thing about this place is they have beers on tap!!

I had the House dog on the Lobster roll and my girl got the dirty chili fries and Were leaving the scene with no evidence of it! So there you have it!!! Kudos

0xzIlpz9o_UA6gbDbp9j8w.text: First time ate yesterday at dirt dog had the Patty melt dog on a lobster roll it was great also had deep fried Oreos mmm food and service was great I highly recommend this place...I will be definitely going back and I want to try all there different style of dirt dogs..

SSxyEAUk1-5lC4dcmxUd-A.text: Go on a weekday otherwise the lines are gonna be way too long. Brown dog was unexpectedly tasty. I suggest trying the ones OTHER than the house dog because honestly that just tastes like a regular loaded hotdog.

xyQn5HusBqI6llJB5Q9N5w.text: The Mutt Dog was amazing and the dirty fries were nice. The Music was on hit too Big Pun was rocking!!

UegFOv233qQD2BGrPTQKrg.text: This place has the best hot dogs ever. The food is greasy but hey its a hot dog wrapped in bacon with amazing toppings! I got the Elote Dog and ugh it was incredible! The flavors were all on point and it came with a lime wedge on top! This place also has all sorts of games you can play while you wait for your food or you can play while you eat, and there were plenty of games to choose from like Monopoly Deal Card Game to Connect 4! Also the staff was very friendly! I will definitely come back!!

WVgoGoiPNfsHH9mreWoJeQ.text: They gave me the wrong order, despite them having someone doing quality control checks on food. I ordered a veggie dog and they gave me meat. Not a huge deal, I understand mistakes happen, but I decided to just drive back across town and get a refund.   They refused to give me a refund and said they'd just remake the food. I said no, so they brought over two more employees to verify what had collapsed on their end and once again they told me that they'd really just like to remake the food.   So, if you want a refund, you'll need to raise your voice, and if you want them to understand what the problem was, you'll need to wait eternity and look over everything four times because they still won't understand and they'll still say they'd feel more comfortable just remaking your food.

AzjSnsFPaEZui96jcJnEAw.text: Today was my first time at Dirty Dog. I have to be honest that the food was great, the cashier was exceptional.He even offered suggestions for our first visit. However the downfall to my visit was the dear busboy,cashierJACOB. We had wanted a booth table that would accommodate and keep my 2 year old wrangled in. Unfortunatly the table was dirty so we were willing to wait for it to be cleaned. JACOB offered us another table but we explained why we preffered this table instead. WELL  that's when inconvianaced Jacob decided to huff and let it be known with his body language that we were making his job difficult with our request. When Thanking him he walked off as being dismissed from American Idol.. We did complain to the young kid who had originally taken our order. He made several apologies for Jacob's behavior. Even went as far to offer coupons and a free dessert. I denied them because I felt that this wasnt this young man's fault. WELL I guess then somehow word got back to Jacob  because he came back to our table to apologize but it really wasnt an apology. It was more defending himself , telling us how we read him wrong. I call it a half ass attempt at taking responsibility that maybe he was having a bad day..All  I know is it didnt leave me feeling happy.  I couldn't wait to get the hell out of there and not be in his presence.. If it wasnt for that expierance I'd say it was the perfect visit..

Z6PIofgw3xpe0IaAUiUwVA.text: Can one review a place after only trying it once? What if it was really, REALLY good? I don't even like hot dogs but I have been wanting to return to Dirt Dog since trying it couple of weeks ago. I had the Patty Melt Dog, Garlic Fries, Dirty Corn, and a Churro. All were freaking good! It was a bit too much food for me but I was feeling greedy and wanted to try everything... Even aside from the toppings and the lobster roll bread and all the toppings, the bacon wrapped hot dog is the best I've ever had. This is the first time in my life, I am craving a hot dog!  The garlic fries is worth to crave as well. Not your typical garlic fries, it's fried to perfection and tossed in garlic oil (made in-house!). The restaurant seemed quite busy, with a steady flow of customers. There are tables and bar seating available. The restaurant also serves beer - perfect partner to a hot dog.

RubMHnSyUiDLg2Fn7r5fww.text: First time here and it's so good! First of all the staff is AMAZING! So friendly, helped us with our order, and constantly checked on us. They also gave us a free order of fried Oreos. The dirt dogs were on point. Can't wait to come back and try more.

1Y_6aMnZ61205P9-49CJLg.text: I love this place the only thing i can't stand is they say you can't sit down until you have a number. I went to grab a table literally being the next in line with my party and was told the tables are for everybody. Apparently everybody except me a paying customer. However I will concede there is a sign that states it.

nLcGtFe1zr5meqbDF4lzMA.text: This is the best hot dog and fries I have ever had. Highly recommend getting the mutt dog and the dirty chili dog also the filthy fries were amazing!!

ubiDJKJ6tN5Jn9Tcoenmng.text: Very good, flavorful choices and reasonable prices. Dessert was even good. Had the churro with horchata creme. Was delicious. Also corn cup was perfect. Chili dog was a little spicy but tasty. Will visit again.

t2JmIAb3Vgq6_wdTdybw7Q.text: Oh Dirt Dog...why can't I give you 10 stars?!?!?!Carne Asada Fries, Green Dog, El Lote Dog(soy dog) were ordered on this last visit and sadly it ended way too early! This place is amazing! These are next level dogs and we really enjoyed the vegetarian option. Carne Asada Fries are a must! The ambiance inside perfectly matches the Tupac playing in the background!

dpPzIc43AbyuAAD_zFN1iA.text: Bacon wrapped hot dog covered in cheese sauce bacon bits and seasoned French fries. Yes this is a Real thing and it's AWESOMENESS!!!!!!!!!!! they have an incredibly varied menu not just hot dogs but also Mexican style Elote street corn on the cob. Not cheap but also not real expensive. Check this place out they have BEER TOO !!!!!! I will be going frequently. Very friendly and informative staff it has an urban / punk rock Vibe super fun place.

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iU3ZSkcYCnjq6O0X-npTrA.text: Soooooo, honestly, I'm sad. I really really wanted to love this place, but I'm just in like at best.  I liked the 4 hotdogs that we had (house dog, red dog, green dog and patty melt dog) but that was it. I was expecting a huge party in my mouth with tons of flavors but I missed the party.   Tupac was playing when I walked in and I felt like I was home, then I saw the board games and thought my 3 year old would have fun here. I got home with my to go order, ate and now I feel jipped.   The house dog had a ton of mayo on it which ruined it for me personally but it should be Great for you mayo lovers. The only thing I tasted on the patty melt was the fries. The red dog had the most flavor but was a little weird for me. The green dog was my fave but I needed more toppings, I was left with a handful of bread at the end. Speaking of bread; I tried all three options and everything was good but I'm not sure what the "lobster" in lobster bread was all about. Tasted like Texas toast to me. The only thing that knocked our socks off was the cashier who took my phone order and gave me my order, she was nice, and dessert. We really enjoyed the fried Twinkie, churros and Horchata ice cream.   I feel like I cant be the only person to not love this place so I'm going to go back and try some other items on the menu even though the bf doesn't want to go back. I was disappointed to find there are several more items on the menu in the restaurant than there were on the dirt dog website menu. I would have been all over some carne asada fries and maybe even the corn with the hot Cheetos!

OkBziKCGW1CuG5ria01U3A.text: They have great service and the food is delicious. We had house dogs on lobster buns and they were great! There's some wonderful beers on tap here too now. I had the Mango Cart and it was a very tasty hef. We also couldn't resist the fried Oreos and churros and it was all perfectly packed Togo and still fresh when we took it home. Sometimes it gets really busy from the social media ads but I think they're marketing department is doing really well. I'm glad to see them expanding and opening new locations like the one at Bally's now! Keep it up guys.

RRnOr3MfepxRkILQzmTXeQ.text: I came here with my friend for a late lunch since it was both our first time trying this place. When we first entered the door there was a lot of people in line waiting for the cahsier to take there orders. The wait time was not that bad since the cashier was really fast at taking our orders. We were lucky to find a table since the place was jammed packed. The serivce is really great here sinc3 they are really fast at serving your food we just sat down at our table and with a few mintues our food arrived at the table My friend ordered the Dirty Chorizo Dog, Carne Asada fries and Dirty Corn. I ordered the Elote Dog and Dirty Corn. Me and my friend really enjoyed here since we left the restuarant on a full stomach. I woould definitely come back here if I am in the area since I live far from here..

AXnxeJdAbv-WT6O1qvToKw.text: Friendly service, great suggestions, and they brought the meal to the table rather than having us stand and wait.  The dog itself it freaking delicious- doesn't matter what topping you might choose, the meat itself was not too greasy or fatty and has a great flavor.  We had the chili and it was NICE! I wasn't as impressed with the cheese sauce, it was a little gritty.  The corn on the cob was covered in a ton of cheese, and while that isn't my preference, some might live that. The corn itself was cooked very well (not chewy or over done)

exVkSXZ1keRHJfNFjUry2A.text: Been here twice in a month!  The employees are very friendly. When you walk in, you are greeted right away. The place will customize your hot dog exactly how you want it.  One thing to point out, they also serve delicious tacos! However, you would never know because the menu board with the tacos is located behind you and not next to the hot dog menu.   The food arrives pretty quickly.  The place is very clean too.  You not want to bring your kids here because the music they are playing is mostly from Tu-Pac (RIP) and his lyrics are a little raunchy.  I hope this place keeps up the good work. I'll keep returning if they do!

qkxTRUmFgTz_Z4IY8nV69w.text: I have been here twice and I am addicted. I love the Dirty Chili Dog. You cannot go wrong when wrapping your hot dogs in bacon. I just tried the Filthy Fries and they are amazing. Everything and everyone here have been amazing. It is close to work so that I can call in an order and have it ready for me to pick up. They food is great and the people are great too.

vAS8holfCmMFEdfLQcWSSw.text: Favorite hot dog place in Vegas! Food is great and the servers are friendly. Lunch does get busy especially when the neighbor high school gets out. My favorite is the Elote Dog.

zG7XPMcQlI7bax8yQDqQxA.text: I recently ate here at dirty dog and the food was really good. There is a line when entering but the line goes fast. Every worker there are friendly and they all smile! Right after we ordered we waited less than 10 minutes and our food was ready. Mind you they are very busy and still managed to get us our food less than 10 minutes. Definitely would come back and recommend others to eat here.

C37Hhc2A5NiPKxHAbOY3ag.text: Food-wise the place is a good solid 4 , fries were excellent, the Red Dog was spicy and tasty, the chili dogs were pretty flavorful also.  When I am in the mood for hot dogs I usually go to Steemie Weenie since it is more on my side of town, but this place will be a good alternative for when a change is needed.

Pztr6Sp82OyVzzo50MEM0A.text: Holy shit this food amazing!!!  The atmosphere is so chill and relaxing and the customer service is the best I've had in a looooong time and sooo clean!!!

o_3ICYCB9F1uMhssiq0kXQ.text: Really good but over priced.  I got two hot dogs, two corn elote, elote fries,  1 beer and a soft drink and churro ice cream for 55$.  Granted the food was great but I wouldn't think I'd end up spending that much for hot dogs.

2HY9xVDv5Nm0Wcj8c4FZiA.text: Best chili dog I have ever had! The lobster roll makes it so much better. Filthy fries are just that... FILTHY and delicious. Tried all three desserts and the churro with horchata ice cream was to die for! Only disappointing thing was everything came out totally separate and not everyone had their food at the same time.

uTAYNm_p5LCrfRiLE7o_Pg.text: Love it ! Like love it.. the house dog is delicious, the horchata fried ice cream is amazing, need to be more happy and smile more often the girls in the front specially a essence of urgency since is always super busy, but other than that they cool !

u5HQ7j8X_GHrWHRyPTOj5w.text: I'm a little confused where all the 5 star ratings are coming from. Firstly, it took 15 minutes to get hot dogs + fries. Then, there was nothing at all impressive about the food. Just standard, not great, hot dogs. The toppings actually made them worse, in my opinion. Even the fries were subpar... How do you mess up fries with garlic on them. I've had dozens of varieties of garlic fries and have never once had to complain about them. Sorry, but I just can't recommend this place. Would rather grill up my own dogs and have them plain as can be...plus save $20

OEKG585eZe-ON0d-_5yZjw.text: I have been seeing this place all over social media for the past month. Super excited when it moved here. This place was a bit of a drive from central LV but worth it. Customer service was awesome, there weren't any negatives about my experience. I would definitely return but can't wait until they open a second location closer to downtown.

OQlSF_0sNfGOQGAac5QTPA.text: Was very disappointed with this place. Especially with all the hype they were putting out. The elotes were small, the eloteros at Sunset Park have bigger corn, they taste better AND they are a whole dollar cheaper.  I ordered the elote esquite and the show it comes in a cocktail cup, nope. Came in a damn jello cup, small as hell. And the street tacos where horrible. No flavor, blan and tasted like cardboard. The only thing that was good were the dogs. Had the Patty melt and it was pretty good. Probably the only thing keeping this place going. Very disappointed.

s99JShSPMapVYgJR3vGAnw.text: Ordered take out but I definitely would like to try it dine in because I know it can be way better.  I ordered the mutt the pastrami and some garlic fries.   When we came to pick up they had some good music playing that made the vibe really chill. The person who checked us out was nice and our food was ready to go when we got there.   The mutt hot dog was so delicious! Pretty spicy and I loved the cilantro and lime.  Fries were fire too.

l6Z7XjAa6KOCyJIOFkP5Hg.text: Hands down, one of the best hot dog places I've ever been. From seeing it all over my instagram and snapchat, it's been on my bucket list for a long time and I finally had the chance to go.   The atmosphere resembles more of a small restaurant but tons of seating though. It's reminds me of eating downtown LA so I felt very nostalgic.   The food was amazing, it's the best part of experience and something I cannot get anywhere else. The fries were so good, they were very generous with the portions and had a lot of toppings on the carne asada fries. The hot dogs are what they're known for and they did not disappoint at all. The dog was so soft and had so much flavor to it while the toppings made the hot dog so unique. I would for sure come back to try different items on the menu.

xmiSX6b4Uo44D_PkKpqXGA.text: This was an excellent choice for quick bite after viewing fireworks. I opted for the House Dog as I didn't want an overwhelming hot dog with multiple ingredients. This tasted like the most basic, yet most delicious hot dog. It consisted of mayo, ketchup, and an aioli sauce, bell peppers, onions, and bacon bits. Yum!!

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Patty Melt &amp; House Dog

iksYSI_xnVrc-t9vhhjN_Q.text: Came here because I swear big brother is listening to me everywhere. I wanted a hot dog when I left MN in the airport. When I landed in LV I immediately saw an ad for Dirt Dog in my feed. What?? Weird. Anyway, I'm glad it happened. This place is awesome.   The dogs are so unique and even the desserts looked unique and tempting.   Ended up getting the carne asada tacos, garlic fries, and chili dog.   The tacos were good and were authentic style. No complaints.  They were full of flavor and the lime brought out the seasonings.   The chili dog was awesome. Full of toppings and the bun choice (lobster roll) was perfect. It was spicy but not too spicy. Could have gotten two of these easily.   Lastly, the garlic fries. They were good and flavorful with real minced garlic on top. The issue is they were sopping and sitting in a huge puddle of oil. Half of them weren't even edible.   Te service was great and everyone was friendly, professional and had a big smile.  I believe it was the manager who was out speaking to customers and clearing tables. She seems to really love her job and care about each customer. I believe her name starts with a B. She is stellar.

Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili dog. Spicy but not too spicy.

GWrFSz35YdLTjxPY1bXjkg.text: I have been to Dirt Dog several times in the past couple years and I have to say... if you are going to do a Dog then do it Dirty! I have tried so many of their menu items in the past and all of them are insanely good!  I especially like the Dirty Corn and the Elote Dog, those are my favorites. The loaded fries are crazy delicious and the quality of those bacon wrapped dogs are great. Dirt Dog also has street tacos which are also delicious, strait up from LA!  Dirt Dog is located on Rainbow close to all the food action in the Enterprise area of Vegas. It is definitely worth the trip to eat dirty!

Vfk-wc2W5pyEaJvDJuYgoA.text: Worth the calories! The ambiance of the place is pretty cool (a lot of graffiti/street art and very nice place to sit down with friends and family). All the food in the menu is very unique and worth trying.

Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Elite Fries

45YYUHsQdil0eS5R60dSDw.text: Awesome spot for a unique and robust hot dog experience! Food is great, people are a treat and the hip hop vibe is super chill.  Had the elote and patty melt and enjoyed both very much! Will definitely be back again as it's the perfect bite when out and about that part of town.

kLvAU6IZARkkjvxC--4tYQ.text: Whenever we're in the mood for an over the top hotdog, we go here.  We've tried almost every dog that they offer and they are all so good.  The hotdogs itself are juicy and the toppings just make it even better.  I highly recommend getting it in the lobster roll.  The soft buttery of it makes it 10 times better.  Oh and here's a tip - make sure to have a napkin close by cause it can get pretty messy.    The restaurant itself has a nice hip hop feel to it with hip hop music playing in the background.  They have murals all around including Tupac and Ice Cube.  Our favorite though is the City of Angels on the back wall.  It just gives it a nice socal homie feel.    Now, be prepared it can get pretty busy here.  The last couple times the line was out the door.  Its so busy sometimes that finding a table to enjoy your meal can be difficult.  If you have a big party, also be prepared to sit separately.  The first time we came we had to sit in two different tables cause there wasn't a big enough table to hold all of us.  Since we have a huge party most of the time, we like to sit down on a table to make sure that we have a table.  Unfortunately, you cannot do that here since there is a big sign that says no saving tables until you have your order number.   It was my husband's first visit the last time we came here and he loved it.  He says it reminds him of Pinks. I can't say I agree with him since I've only been there once.  That's pretty sad to say out loud considering I'm a socal native **don't judge me** . But yea, they don't only serve dogs, but elotes, fries, tacos, and fried desserts.  We still haven't tried their fried twinkies and/or oreos but plan to someday.  Overall the service, wait, and food was great.  Will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green dog, dirty esquite
Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Regular dog, house dog, pastrami dog and fries
Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #TheDirtyCorn &amp; patty melt dog

FUrEaZtBcSCHPwuTvQ-iVw.text: The food is delicious and the staff is very friendly and helpful! I've been a few times now and have never been disappointed with the food or service! Please open a Dirt Dog in the Centennial area soon so we can enjoy more often!

R1aUajDHfWT_WVejZpnx7A.text: Cool place, fast and friendly service. Food is good, there's many choices of hotdog and fries on the menu. I had the house dog and dirty fries and it was good. Food is on the saltier side so you should watch for sodium intake.

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zozl9RUsLZidCKzCtGYHGg.text: Ahh this place most definitely deserves the hype it is getting. It is so yummy! A small, modern, cute little restaurant. The menu offers quite a variety of over the top hot dogs and French fries. I had the chili cheese dog and oh.em.gee was it delicious. The Texas toast is a must for a bun. I love that there are so many options and everything is different. The service was great, everyone was continuously asking if we needed help or if we had everything. I also tried the churro with horchata whipped cream and I highly suggest because it's amazing!   This is a place I will be returning to and anyone wanting to try it should stop in immediately!

W-RhuTmfEec5BA7AEM32dw.text: What a fun place to eat out! We were looking for somewhere unique and stumbled on Dirt Dog.  For starters the menu is heavy, with lots of feel good food wrapped into a hot dog. We are basic, and got a basic hot dog with ketchup, mustard and onions. The bun was delish and fresh with a yummy crisp to it. The hot dog itself was very filling.  The fries, garlic fries were yummy! Brought back memories of eating them at Dodger Stadium.  Lastly we tried the fried Oreos, which paired with the cream sauce was to die for.  All in all, a great experience. The atmosphere feels like your walking the streets of LA and the service is great. If you're looking for a new try, this is a great Vegas find!

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Regular Hot Dog
Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Fries

-RH5mFQsrawBdJe0zpQkDA.text: OMD! OH MY DOGTM!!!! Yes I said it.  I HATE hotdogs! With that said, I was dreading the 33 min 26 mile, drive with my Boo here. Why couldn't we just get Pho? When I saw that there was a pho restaurant next door, I was ok. If the dogs did not work, can always go next door.   Located in the same plaza as The Lodge on Rainbow and Windmill, there is plenty of parking. Greeted with 6 screens of menus when we walked in, we definitely did not know what we were getting in to. Dirty dog, flaming dog, red dog, and mutt dogs, oh my. What is going on with these names? The atmosphere is dope. An indoor street feel with BEER. The music brought me back to my B-Boy days. As I'm writing this Planet Rock by Africabamba is playing. About to bust on the floor here. Oh, that's breakdancing for you millennials. Customer service here is very friendly and suggestive, if you just so not know what to get. Like me.  What ordered: Pastrami dog  Elote dog DUI fries Flaming corn  Obviously if your reading more, I stayed. Yup, I am now a fan of hot dogs. As long as it's smothered in pastrami, MJ cheese, bacon bits, sweet pepper, and pickles. 1 bite and that was it. As you can see in the pictures, I am happy. So if your ur in the NW, North, East side or wherever part of town and would like an out the ballpark dog, stop by.

0nDpUmL1xEqEe6i2i7g2Lg.text: Had they smashed the toppings into the doggie further I would have given a 5 star review, instead, one had to bite 2 separate bites to enjoy the taste together with the dog :'(  Lol but fr & the DUI fries were a little dry and some doggies were spicier than anticipated.  But overall, I'd eat there again! Tasty.

rpMKMhCIF9ZboJpasSpI4A.text: So sad....after weeks of trying to go here I finally had some time to check out their Veggie Dog with one of my friends. But after sitting in traffic for almost 30 minutes, I arrived to find out that they were out of the Veggie Dog :'(. Being a non meat eater I was out of options and had to be at work soon so unfortunately I left for work hungry, at least they were nice enough to offer me a free soda for my troubles....but that's one hour of my life I will never get back plus working 8+ hours on my feet without food is never fun.

INULIIyVPSYLekRm-VzvmQ.text: Surprisingly good. I didn't expect much from a glorified hot dog stand, but I enjoyed the place and I'll be back. I ordered the house dog. It was very flavorful and better eaten with a knife and fork.   The place was really hopping. A wide ranging age group. They also have a really nice beer selection that is decently priced. The dirty fries were excellent!

yEFYxuL79YimvpfiUnSONw.text: Great place, delicious food !! We ordered the carne asada tacos and The green dog with 2 corn esquite, the jamaica drink is fantastic !!

NpweAUiBxlSebPGCYM8clA.text: It has been a few months since I've been here (I think around January and I remember because it was winter break for me). The last time I went here, it was FANTASTIC and UNIQUE. I'm going to go in depth, the end I will have a pro and con list if you really just want to skip over.  So, I went here and I walk in and the line is FILLED with people. I mean FILLED. We were barely at the entrance. I'm a very patient and excited person, so I didn't mind the wait at all. It was all worth the hype after all!  Food 5/5:  I ordered a normal Hot Dog and Carne Asada Fries. The quality of the food was super duper good. It was fresh and hot straight off the grill. I'm not really a huge fan of hotdogs, but I ate most of it anyways! It was really good. My favorite thing in the restaurant was actually the Carne Asada Fries. If there is anything I love to combine, its definitely Carne Asada and Fries. Dirt Dog just happened to perfectionize the food! It was just perfect, there is no other word to describe. Fries were crisp, the carne was perfectly juicy, the sauces and veggies were fresh, etc.   Customer Service 5/5: Like I said before, the place was very busy. There was a huge line, from the front of the cashier all the way to the door (Which isn't far apart from each other, but trust me when I say there was a lot of people). When my family & I got up to the cashier, they were very kind and took their time when it came to taking orders (We were quick anyways, since we had a lot of time to decide what we wanted from the menu, so its fine). The Employees were great, they're great chill people and I love that.   Atmosphere 5/5: I absolutely LOVE the atmosphere. They have a cool map where people outside of Vegas can pin where they came from (As in if you're from Austin, Texas, you would be able to put a small little baby flag pin with your initials if you really wanted to!). They also have a lot of good, original art that I'm sure has supported local artists (Which I absolutely adore because I, myself, am an artist and I love/am very passionate about local art). The music was old school hip hop and stuff. The style and everything about the place is just unique, different, and awesome. It's just filled with positive, chill energy. I loved it so much. It kind of felt like home away from home in a way. I wish more restaurants were more like this location. Instead of trying to be fancy and snazzy, they should be more authentic (like this place).   Pros -Wonderful food you're going to fall in love with -Good & nice employees -Creative and authentic style  -Good & Local art -Good old school music playing  Cons -Not really any, but if you're inpatient or have anxiety when it comes to being around a lot of people, I wouldn't come during busy hours  Things to consider -If you do not like Hip styled places, I do not recommend coming here (I know some older folks that do not like 'Hip, Youthful' styled places) -If you are inpatient and cannot handle waiting 10 minutes (to order), I wouldn't come during busy hours  -If you have anxiety being around a lot of people, I wouldn't come during busy hours either

TSHIKwFgBYbX3ILQgqcrnQ.text: If you want an over the top hot dog... This is the place to go. I'm usually not a hot dog eater, but I felt like I just had to check this place out and it was worth the drive. The music helped too, the bump 90's hip hop here and those jams just took me back. BIG - big poppa, LL cool j - round the way girl, and just a bunch of stuff to take you back.  The tacos here are fantastic, I had the Al pastor and asada. The tortillas we're perfectly made. Then the elote... Which is called esquite or something when it's cut up and in a cup. It was good but could have used more mayo and butter. The veggie dog was a bit dry, but the pastrami dog rocked my world. Soooooo juicy! Get it with a lobster bun to experience perfection.   For dessert, we had horchata and a churro nothing that really stood out, I've had better, and I've had worse, but i came here for the dogs and I wasn't disappointed.

The price isn't a point of contention. It could be better but that's not a big deal. The occasional congestion at the door and order counter is more concerning. Will go back again.

qKEbxIjN9bKy1TLqwyhuIQ.text: In love with there hot dogs and fries and elotes. Been here twice.  i have to try the deep fried oreos and tacos when i go back. Would love for my mom and  brothers to come try them. I bet they eill fall in love.

HzlbgLvXtckMt8S1kZ7xJw.text: Update: Dirt Dog reached out to my husband and me and asked for another chance, and we're so glad we did! We got the Elote Dog, Dirty Esquite, Dirty Corn, and Flaming Corn.   The Elote Dog was amazing! It has a cheesy base topped with a juicy dog smothered in sauced corn and bacon bits. Very rich and satisfying. The Dirty Corn is lightly grilled after steaming so it's got more complexity than standard street corn, a crisp bite and juicy sweetness that marries the salty, crunchy, savory bacon bits. The Dirty Esquite is the Dirty Corn in a cup so it's a perfect flavorful, to-go snack! The Flaming Corn is definitely hot when you eat the whole thing, so I was happy to have other items to eat with it.   The staff was outstanding, as usual. Every part of this meal was delicious! I recommend every item, and this meal more than redeemed our previous experiences. We will be back!!  - - - It was just ok. We went there just to try their corn, and they've been out both times we've gone. I had the green dog and my husband had the house dog. The house dog was better tasting, but they were both really dry. It looks nice when it comes to you, but the sauce is more decorative and soaks into the bun so fast that a few bites in, it just tastes like a dry hotdog with an occasional onion. The people behind the counter were very nice both times, though. N

8ntzJbT4Acbak9RVJro7wQ.text: One of the best Gourmet Hot Dog restaurants in Las Vegas! I pretty much rushed over to this eatery soon after grand opening. The restaurant is nice and spacious. I love the fries. They are always fresh and crispy. I recommend the Horchata Ice Cream!! It is AMAZING. I eat here quite frequently. They have excellent staff who are super friendly and help you out with any questions. I love the entire menu! I believe Uber eats also delivers from here.

plQ5QiEn6MuSxfKjLmG_PA.text: This place was great!! My husband and I love hot dogs and dirty dogs from LA so this felt like a little piece of LA. I got the house dog I think it was called. It was good, to me it wasn't anything too special. Just a basic good hot dog.   My husband got the green dog and that one was good! I love the guac and lime in it. Definitely different from what I've had before. We got garlic fries which were good too.  Best thing about this place is their elote! Oh man it was amazing. They grill their corn, it was so juicy and good. As good as your elote man for sure! Definitely would come back for the hot dogs and elote. My husbands new favorite place!

CWNkrtK0zeapPvKbFNYT0Q.text: You really can't go wrong with LA inspired hotdogs. Why wouldn't anyone want to put a hot bacon wrapped weiner in their mouth and just have a foodgasm after? Honestly i've only been to two different hotdog spots like this and I highly approve of the idea. This brings eating hotdogs to a whole new level.   I fell in love with the vibe as soon as I entered. They were bumping Pac in the back and had memorabilia of his genius. This is place is pretty lit and not too hard on the eyes.  So we ordered the Elote dog and some #Filthyfries. Both were amazing. They even gave us an extra ranchero dog on the side and man. I really appreciate that gesture because that one was my favorite. Be expecting me to head over again but don't get me wrong. I love the old Cheeburger Cheeburger spot however Dirt Dog became my new love. I'll be back to try the other dogs and fries.   Food is an adventure am I right?

mF8gSuztihDLFUMkTYOaew.text: I had been wanting to try this place for a while and I'm glad I finally did as it did not disappoint!   I had the patty melt dog which was super bomb! A little hard to eat because it was so big but that's not really a bad thing! The regular bun held up really well and was so soft and tasty even on it's own.   I also had the dirty corn which was ok, it wasn't the best thing ever and I would probably just order something else next time instead.   The horchata was really good.   We came on a Friday night and it was very busy so there was limited seating. The service was great everyone was very nice and helpful.

fxlI2E2KJBBtYLjNVKQgCg.text: Simply went cause of the great yelp reviews. We weren't disappointed.  I got the chili dog. Husband got the one with thousand island bacon dressing.  Very good hotdogs. Both were unique and tasty.  The oreos and the horchata ice cream were delicious as well. Only issue I see is the fries.  Now, maybe if you load them up with stuff they're good but, they leave much to be desired.  Oh almost forgot... the elote (corn) in the cup!!! Holy smokes is it delicious!!! Will come again.

oDOGbukYN3udqZkdSYhOOQ.text: One of the best dog places in Vegas. Coming from LA and having Carney's and Pink's, I have had no shortage of finding a good dog. This coming to Vegas was a much needed addition. Have tried the Dirty Chili Dog, the House Dog and the Elote Dog and recommend the Hose Dog and the Elote Dog. The Dirty Chili Dog is good, had it on the Portuguese Roll, but I only slightly prefer Carney's or Pink's over it. The House and Elote dogs were great on the lobster roll.  Sauces, add ons, and condiments were a perfect match on both of these if ordered as is. Would suggest either of these as your first dog here on the lobster roll. The sweet Portuguese roll doesn't seem to work for me and may be why I wasn't sold on the chili dog on my first visit. Hint, ask them then to cut the dog in half and you can share with a friend and try a different dog.

XScApmZjIdliNJb_MeqFQg.text: I'm actually sad to say everything was great. I was secretly hoping to not like anything about this place as its been a conscious decision of mine to stay away from hot dogs for over a year now. Decent beer selections. Took the cashiers recommendation on the Dog to get and it was super tasty. Will most likely be holding a cheat meal here from time to time.

CcPdPBf7eE9KdRhQKfwkqw.text: I was so excited to try this place because I'd been craving a good hot dog. I don't eat red meat so it's hard to find a good hot dog place. Their menu has a veggie dog option so I was def in!   Veggie dogs can go wrong real quick because they can be mushy and have no flavor. I ordered the veggie dog green style and dirty fries. They were a little slow but as soon as I saw the food I was like YUM!! This is one of the few times I can say the real food looks better than the photos on the menu!   The dog was soooo good!! The frank itself was a little bland but the texture was perfect. The toppings had so much flavor that the frank didn't even matter. The dirty fries were amazing!! I wanted more!! Definitely coming back to try more of their goodies!!

The hot dogs are on another level, get the lobster rolls. Cold Beer is a plus, this place must be on your list to try. Don't let the hot dog part keep you from trying.

bivT13LeeVTl-BXJwkGLUw.text: Stopped in on my way to work the other day because they were recognizing first responders and emergency workers.  Thank you for supporting our brave first responders and supporting our community   Found the staff to be friendly, the service was fast and the food was great.   Will have to stop back with the wife on day when I'm not on duty for some adult beverages.   #VegasStrong

awCL8Hl0d1wC0LR0LmJ8ew.text: Wow delicious! So so good, why they used this terrible name I don't know, but the food is great.  The buns are soft but substantial and hold the many amazing topping and fillings in each dog. The chili in the chili dog is real meat. The hotdogs are scrumptious, they would be great even with nothing on them, so the toppings are all a great bonus! Ordered three menu items (instead of making my own) and they were all stellar. The first one on the menu was the best one.

Q6lwCQPPKEUe--ESApPieQ.text: Watch out, Las Vegas! The only bad thing u can say about this place is that it's so close to my house (there goes the diet)!   Upon entering, we were greeted by a very friendly woman at the counter with bright pink hair. The dining room is very cool/hip/clean. The music is mix of something you'd hear in LA - some reggae, kayne, and sublime made for a relaxed feel (maybe not so much the kayne, but personal opinion ha!).   We were asked if we had been there before and said "no." The cashier went on to tell us about their hot dogs and which things she enjoyed the most. I went with the Red Dog and asked for the chili flakes on the side (I get worried when cooks have the ability to scorch my mouth with pepper flakes), the "Dirty Esquite," a fried Twinkie  and a fountain drink. Came to roughly $14 - not bad at all!  The hot dog was pretty spicy without the flakes on top for a garnish. It was super flavorful, had a nice snap/crunch, and the traditional bun was perfect with it. The Esquite was packed with flavor! It comes with a lime wedge, which you definitely want to use. The fried Twinkie was, well, a fried Twinkie. It was delicious. But what set it off was the horchata whipped cream! Can i have that on every dessert for the rest of my life please?!  I can't wait to come back and try new dogs, sides and I'll be hitting that fried Oreos and churros on the next go 'round! Well done, Dirt Dog! Well done, indeed!

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Dog (chili flakes on the side), Esquite, and Fried Twinkie with Horchata Whipped Cream!

a3j3M1Zf4jiXZRzeyC4xOg.text: Their hot dogs and sides are the best things I've ever tasted. I had a Chili Dog on a buttered toast and Elote fries. I couldn't get enough of either of them. Their service was very speedy and a kitchen staff came out to check on the quality of food. I always appreciate restaurants that care for customers feedback to improve. Will go back many times.

R5b4sfO78Rzsce9T09HrvA.text: I had high hopes for this place. I do wanna say that the customer service was on point! The girl that was working the register had a great attitude and helped us with all kinds of questions. That's pretty much why they got three stars out of me.   The food...le sigh...I wasn't that excited. It tasted alright. My husband ordered The Green Dog and it was flavorful but the bread was pretty hard. I ordered the Dirty Chili Dog and it was ehh...nothing out of the ordinary. I did order it with the lobster bread which if you do decide to try out this place I recommend trying the hot dogs with the lobster bread! Makes it much more better. We also ordered garlic fries and BOY did I regret it. I felt like I was eating the whole clove of garlic. Waaaaay to much.   I loved the atmosphere there. Very laid back. Would I return again...honestly no. Even though they were very friendly and customer service was great but the food wasn't so great.

tbu9JgIUgTF2jr4JU8E1qQ.text: Man this place is just awesome. Everything from the service to the atmosphere is an A+. Great food. My fiance and I have been wanting to try this place and we finally took the drive across town Friday night for a little cheat meal/date night. When we got there man it was busy but the staff is great so the line moves quick. Since it was our first time we wanted to try quite a bit so we ordered the patty melt dog, the dirty chili dog, the dirty corn, and the filthy fries. We held off on dessert to see how big the portions were. MAN these hot dogs are huge and sooooo good. Everything was amazing. We were both so full at the end of our meal we didn't get dessert.. BUT next time for sure. This place is amazing. Definitely go try it out for yourself. A+ all the way around.

_AgnZ1a-hYi-j5P3i9IAoA.text: Food is always delicious. Service was horrible today. First in line and it took about 12 minutes to place an order. The staff saw me in line and did not even acknowledge me for all that time. They finally came around to help me and asked if I was paying in cash or card. I stated cash and they weren't able to immediately help once again. In addition to the horrible service they changed their menu from a $2 taco to a minimum of two tacos for $6  disappointing.

VP2S-OiKB33Am_101qeOzw.text: Hubby showed me the menu and we decided to call in an order. Good thing too because when he went to pick them up at 7:30 on a Saturday night and he said it was packed! My husband and son got plain bacon wrapped dogs on a butter bun and seasalt fries. No complaints there. I had the brown dog and filthy fries. I just about died with every bite of the brown dog. The flavor profile was spot on; saltiness of the dog and the sweet and savory of the teriyaki and sesame on the Portuguese bun. I got the chipotle aoli on the side which was a good thing since the salt and pepper already added a nice kick to the fries. Ended up maxing out but happily full.  Next was the churros. This was the only reason we took off a star. They were kind of puny in size (that's what she said) and unfortunately while they looked tasty, they ended up being raw inside.  All in all a great meal. We will probably pass on dessert next time. The takeaway message here is that there will likely be a next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brown dog and Filthy Fries

EIZ4amWNAN6pWAN5YKVVBg.text: I'm just amazed... we saw the ad on Instagram, and it led us here! Definitely the best hot dog I've ever had, the prices were fine by me. I'll be coming her a lot because this is incredible.

i7C3WpLYSRnHurh_lm-NLQ.text: As we were waiting on line, we noticed that many people left their half eaten hot dogs and corn on the table... hmmm... not a good sign that they didn't want to finish their food...  This was our first time trying this place out & will be our last time.  Waiting on line got a bit aggravating as people were pushing while they were trying to leave.    My kids don't eat a lot of junk food so with that being said, they think hot dogs and mexican corn is a luxury and "special" treat so they waited with highened anticipation for their late lunch.    We ordered 2 chili dogs, 1 plain mexican corn and 1 order of fries.  We were given 1 chili dog and 1 plain dog with no chili.  The one that actually had chili only had 1 bean in the chili mix.  Ummm... that was a bit strange.    My son took one bite of the mexican corn and said it was no good.  So I tried it myself to see what he was fussing about and I too, did not like the taste of it.  It just tasted weird.  Just at that moment, I turned to the table next to ours and saw that they had left without finishing their corn... they actually just took one bite and didn't eat the rest.  Uhhh I should have followed my instincts and not ordered the corn but my boy was begging for it.  I actually make it myself at home but figured it was easier to just order one then firing up the grill.  Lesson learned.    So, the hot dogs had no flavor and was not worth the $8.00 price tag. I would have been happier with Costco's hot dogs or buying Nathan's. The fries were bad too.  Who would have thought that they could mess up fries?  But they did.  I don't know what the deal is with them but after eating one, no one wanted any more.  Especially the kids.  They usually would scruff down fries and hot dogs in a jiffy, but this time after only 1 bite, they didn't want anymore.  My boy kept saying that he'll have pho from the restaurant next door.    So the ordering and waiting system is a little weird.  I went to sit down with the kids as my husband went to order the food.  Apparently I couldn't sit with the kids until I ordered and got a number.  Then I noticed there was a sign that said, "No room to wait on the line."  Right, so that's why I want to go sit... but I couldn't until I got a number... One of the staff members actually came over to me to tell me that I needed to get up and get a number. That I had to let the people with numbers sit first. I told her that my husband was ordering the food right now and that the kids were tired and hungry.  I didn't go there to take up space and hog a table.  I was waiting on food.  Geesh, is that how they really do business?  I mean, do I look homeless or something where I'm just there to hang out and not buy anything?  The floors were really dirty, no one really sweeping up.  Seems like the employees were just pushing the table scraps onto the floor.  Maybe they have a dog somewhere where it comes and eats it all up (haha, maybe that's where they came up with their name).  But in all seriousness, it was not cool the way they treated me and my kids especially since my husband was already ordering.  They couldn't just let us sit for a couple of minutes while he paid and got a number?  Seriously, totally uncalled for.    I won't be back to spend my hard earned money at a place that doesn't value their customers or even serve decent food.

PNuZh9Qfz0hRenMueM1OgA.text: All what you can say is WOW!!! First time here, but what an atmosphere, what a customer service... what a doooog. Already at home and still feel the taste of the  MUTT DOG. And this one wasn't enough... I want it to try them all ...  got also the PASTRAMI DOG .. Beer definitely will go again. Nice job guys Strongly Recommend if someone want to try something different and tasty, this is the right place

j98je_8rUxCJVOTyxsrPVw.text: This place is awesome! Food is awesome! People working there are friendly! You can play board games at the table with ur friends or family. They serve alcohol. Love the atmosphere. Try the hot Cheetos chili dog!! Highly recommended!

1yYiT-olN8t1bsMojSxniQ.text: Would love to give Dirt Dog a 4.5/5 if I could. I finally got to try them out during a recent trip to Vegas. The line was out the door, so I knew this place was going to be good as everyone said it was! I ordered their elote, and two street tacos--one carne asada, the other al pastor.   The restaurant itself is a decent size, but because of their constant surplus of customers, my cousins and I had to stand around and wait for a table to clear up, as most of the other diners there were in big groups. However, we didn't wait too terribly long for our food to come out, which was brought to us by one of their friendly staff members. I opted out of getting the elote with the hot cheetos, but it was still very, very delicious! My tacos were likewise very flavorful. Sadly, they were smaller than I expected them to be, which was a little disappointing.   I definitely want to eat here again, hopefully to try one of their hot dogs and indulge on another elote! It would be great if they opened up another location, too!

6GgraugDEypkXZJFmhXlCg.text: If youre in the mood for something very heavy this might be the place to go. It was our first time here just to check out. They have different selection of hotdogs with variety of toppings that come with it, as well as french fries with toppings as well. All staff were very friendly and nice, came around asking how we were all doing from time to time. They food comes out pretty quick and there are TV's for customers to watch.   This will be a place i come every so often, when im craving for a flavorful hotdog and french fries.

V0PX-Hrg7FK97gS-tQvTjA.text: My boyfriend saw one of their posts on their flaming corn and was mesmerized. Every time I've asked him where he wants to eat, he says this place. I don't eat meat so I've never said yes. But I finally gave in. Upon searching the menu, I saw that they have a veggie dog (win for me). I got their mutt dog with a veggie dog. It was so good!! I savored every bite. It was of their red and green hot dog -- half citrusy and half spicy. My boyfriend had their elote dog. While good, he said there was too much going on.   We also had the flaming elote and dirty fries. And wow. I stuffed every last bite of everything. I let no fry or piece of corn go to waste. The flaming elote had hot Cheetos and some aioli on it. It had the perfect amount of spice and crunch and taste to it. The dirty fries came with chipotle ranch. And the seasoning was so good!!  I would recommend. I like that it is vegetarian friendly as well. Yuuummmm

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mTkIUe8a34VeG35KGW0tCw.text: My husband and I have wanted to try this for a while and we're both so happy we finally made the 30 minute drive over here. We got there around 6 and the line was very long. Brian came up to the line to ask if there was any first timers and out of the 20+ people in line, we were the only ones. He explained the menu to us, made recommendations, and then asked if we wanted to grab a seat. He sat us down, took our entire order at the table, and checked us out so we didn't have to wait in line. We had our toddler with us that we were holding so it was really appreciated! He came and checked on us a couple times as well. The customer service was really great.   The food was great too! I had the green dog, my husband got a chili dog, and we decided to split a house dog (which they cut for us before they brought it to the table). We also got a side of garlic fries and an Al pastor taco just because. Everything was really good and really filling.   We will definitely be going back because I want to try the elote dog next! Thank you Brian!

Ab5ZnBnAHLKts_1VogC_Ug.text: I order chili fried, it came with no chili. Rip off. Chili hot dog was good . I was charge for lobster for butter brea  My second visit. Thanks Melbourne E. For picking up my tab. The Clilli dog and chilli fried were excellent. When I return to the area, I will be back. Service was excellent. Again thanks for inviting me back.

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DO5UDB4zB5gn3BkIduAY8w.text: Craving food from the City of Angels? This is one if the places that originated from LA. Located in a small shopping center in Southwest Las Vegas, you will find locals and a lot of people from Cali checking this place out.   When you walk in, line to order is just ahead. Did not like that part as this creates heavy traffic that loops the line into the exit line and to the people entering the establishment. This makes it hard for new comers and repeated customers from deciding on what to order. The menus itself are displayed to the right side of the wall making it harder for people to take a look see at the menu.   Inside they is pretty small as well, especially for those who have families to eat dinner with. There is a capacity of up to 30 people or so. If you plan on eating there come before 6 oclock. My fiance and I got lucky. Right when we walked in we were able to order right away.   Now the menu. They are known for their hot dogs and the street foods. The street foods they offer: street tacos, fried foods (fried oreos, Twinkies), horchata ice cream w/churro, garlic fries, chips, elote, and a few things off the secret menu.   What we ordered: the extra dirty chilli dog. You can choose from three different buns, but the one we chose was the lobster roll. The dog was dressed with onions, cilantro, chilli cheese, and topped with bacon. I ordered the horchata ice cream w/churro. We waited not long for the hot dog, but literally waited for more than half an hr for the ice cream. The girl working the tables and serving the orders had a bit of a miscommunication that I already received my order. Knowing that it was busy, she got upset, but later apologized.   How the food tasted: the hot dog was a 3/5 as the dog looked wayyyy bigger in other pictures. Its smaller in person, and the taste was over hyped. The bacon was too chewy and the bun made it extremely greasy rather than that OMG factor in our mouth feeling. However, the horchata ice and churro made up for the rest of our visit. Churro was hot and just freshly made. Horchata ice cream concept made me enjoy every bite as the ice cream tasted like the drink. Cinnamon, the nuts, and flavor balance out well.  Overall, will come back to try the other food when it is less busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Dirt Dog - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Horchata ice cream with churro

isoXYi0YgN3LHNdJz0by5w.text: Love love love Dirt Dogs in LA and this VEGAS division does not fail!   Walking in made me instantly miss LA with 2pac's image watching over as you walk in.   Every hot dog on this menu is Bomb ! It just depends on the flavors you like. I got the Green Dog my kid got the Dirty Chili and we also got the Dirty Elote and the Filthy Fries by recommendation of the young lady at the register and her recommendation was spot on!   I can't even finish the food as eating fast food is hard for me anyhow but man I wish I could gobble it all up and I'm sure I will eventually.   The dogs are excellent quality. The lobster rolls are everything and give me ultra life!!!!         I can't wait to bring my friends from the east and Midwest out here ! Especially my Chicago cousins.   Come by and have a great meal of dogs n fries!  Fanessa is Management Material for sure ! Very attentive !! Very pleasant , ,polite , professional  and pretty !

aXqZuEnMQcyQbVmfdgLKAQ.text: They had me on their Elotes!  I went and try this place because they have Elotes which I've been craving for. I was with my friend, Minda and both of us enjoyed their food and the ambiance of their place. Except for the part that they almost forgot our dessert order.   Menu: House Dog - because we wanted to try their dog we just opt for the simplest one---doesnt have too much garnish. We don't want to go crazy because we are really looking forward in trying their elotes.  Elotes - must try!  Dirty Corn and Flaming Corn - if you are an elote fan like me, this is a must try on their menu. If you ask, they can also cut the corn  so it's easier to eat or if you are sharing.   Garlic Fries - Yummy!   Fried Oreos and Churros - it was ok but I felt overwhelmed after eating them. I think because I was so full after eating all the carbs.
